Mmm! Mmm! Fry, you're my friend!  C'mon, everyone line up for a hug. Let's tear down some emotional walls.
What are you doing to my ship?
Sanctifying it!  There! That ought to convert a few tailgaters.
Bender's stupid religion is driving me nuts.
If only he had joined a mainstream religion like Oprah-ism or Voodoo.
We've got to get the old Bender back.
And I think I know a way to do it. We have to reacquaint him with a little thing called "sleaze".
I can't believe somebody hired an interstellar spaceship to deliver a package to Atlantic City. What are we delivering anyway?
Where are we delivering it to?
Another job well done. Now back to the office for an enjoyable evening of fasting and repentance.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, wait, Bender. So long as we're here why don't we take in some, exotic dancing!
But, those girls don't wear cases. You can see their bare circuits.
Come on, it'll be fun! Maybe we could even drink a little fortified wine.
What?" Drinking wine is a sin. Even if it is deliciously fortified.
Hey, Bender, looks at that woman's purse. It's hanging by a spaghetti strand.
And there's Hookerbot 5000. She's got a heart of solid gold!
Stop tempting me! For once in my life I have inner peace.
Pfft, that's for losers. C'mon, sin your heart out.
Go for it, Bender. You know you wanna!
I'm the greatest.  Woo-hoo!
Look's like we got the old Bender back!
You know it, pork pie! Except for one thing.

Y'know, as a major Hollywood director I'll be holding auditions tonight for my next movie. And even though you're all young and naive, I think you might just have what it takes.  Hey! I'm trying to score here! Can't you read the "Do Not Disturb" sign?  No! No!
What in hell happened to Bender?
Well he didn't check out. The ashtray's still here.  Look, Nibbler's caught the scent of vodka and motor oil! Go, boy. Follow that stench.
I'm hallucinating this, right?
But I don't belong here. I don't like things that are scary and painful.
Aww, hell - I mean heck!
Wait! I remember this place. They shut it down after all those people caught salmonella from the flume ride.
Hmm. Look! It's the symbol of Bender's old religion.
Unbelievable. It's an actual, factual Robot Hell.
Who would've thought hell would really exist? And that it would be in New Jersey!
Aw crap, singing. Mind if I smoke?
(singing) Just tell me why.
(singing) There must be robots worse than I.
(singing) Then please let me explain,
(singing) Ah, don't blame me blame my upbringing!
(singing) I don't feel well.
(singing) It's up to us to rescue him.
(singing) Maybe he likes it here in hell.
(singing) It's us who tempted him to sin.
(singing) Maybe he's back at the motel.
(singing) Come on, Fry, don't be scared,
(singing) My ass has blisters from the slide.
Bender, are you alright?
No! Oh they're tormenting me with up-tempo singing and dancing.
Alright, Beelzebot, what'll it take to get our friend back?
Wait. What fiddle contest?
Wouldn't a solid gold fiddle weigh hundreds of pounds and sound crummy?
(whispering) Do you know how to play the fiddle?
(whispering) No, do you?
(whispering) No, but I used to play the drums. They're sorta similar. (talking) What happens if we lose?
Time for the drum solo!
I could if you'd drop the stupid gold violin!
Don't worry, guys, I'll never be too good or too evil again. From now on, I'll just be me.
Uh, do you think you could be just little less evil than that.
I don't know. Do you think you could survive a 700ft fall?
That was the worst delivery ever.
Yeah. I'm never going to another planet called Cannibalon!
Me neither. (upbeat) Food was good, though.
Oh, great news, everyone.
In that case I'll have to hire a new crew to go on our company vacation.
This is great! I haven't had time off since I was 21 through 24.
It's just my way of thanking you for not reporting my countless violations of safety and minimum wage laws.
I've booked us all on the maiden voyage of the largest, most luxurious space cruise ship ever built.  The Titanic!
Hey, uh, where's my suitcase?  Ow!
Oh, God! Not Zapp Brannigan!
Let's just say we've "crossed paths".
Was that before or after you slept with him?
It's tempting, but, uh, I have a fiancÃ© now. Uh, hmm, uh, hmm, uh, we--, uh ...  Him! Fry, darling, meet Zapp Brannigan.
Huh?  Ooh! How do you do?
Ah, here's my stateroom.
Come on, where is it?  Ohh!
Now, Hermes, you and your lovely wife LaBarbara have the suite through there. And Dr. Zoidberg, your marble tank is on the other side.
Man, first class seems nice!
It'll seem even nicer once you've seen your room.
Well at least we get a window!
Well, I'm tired of this room and everyone in it. If you'll excuse me, I'm gonna pop over to the casino for the next 135 hours!
I guess that just leaves you and your fake fiancÃ© ... all alone ... on a romatic cruise.
Take it off or I'll break it off.
Hmm.  I'm bettin' it all!  Come on, baby needs a new pair of feet!
No! My cheating unit malfunctioned! You gotta give me a do-over!
Gimmie you're biggest, strongest, cheapest drink.
Allow me to introduce myself. I'm Bender.
I assure you, I barely know the meaning of the word "labour".
Please, call me Bender.
Well, our accommodations aren't great but it sure is beautiful our here.
Yeah, it's pretty romantic-- Uh, I mean platonic. Th-That sure is one platonic view!
Fry, just be quiet. I'm beginning to think this whole fake fiancÃ© thing was a terrible, terrible--
Uh, look, before you get any crazy ideas, that was for Zapp.
Well, you got anything else for him?
Alright, can we try not to complicate this?
See you later, wuvvums!
It would have been nice if you'd told me you were going out with Amy.
I'm not going out with Amy. It's just to fool her parents. Hey, you're not jealous, are you?
What? No. No! Of course not!
Good, 'cause I consider my fake relationship with you a lot more meaningful.
I was just about to suggest the same thing.  Pay dirt!
Yeah. But only 93% as lovely as you.
I don't get it, iZac: That bracelet had a diamond the size of a racoon's brain. Why couldn't I steal it?
Oh, it's true. But we're star-crossed robots. She, a countess built with a silver spoon in her mouth. And me, just a regular honest Joe.
Fellas, please. I'm in love!
Though it did get me some action!
But I didn't even limbo.
Well, now you know. I'm not actually rich. I'm a fraud. A poor, lazy, sexy fraud. This isn't even a real bow-tie -- it's magnetic.
Well, rest assured, Leela's the only girl for me.
(whispering) What are we gonna do? Fry can't pretend to be both our boyfriends.
(whispering) Sure I can. I learned how to handle delicate social situations from a little show called Three's Company.
Um, let me think. Come and knock on our door, nuh nuh nuh nuh nuh nuh. Uh, Mr Roper--
Wait, I'm confused. Now tell me, Fry, which one of these ladies are you involved with?
Ah, now there's something we can all enjoy.
Hey, Leela, why'd you run off from dinner?
I didn't run off. I had plenty of time to finish eating and stroll away while you were kissing Amy.
Oh, look, I'm not actually interested in her if that's what's bothering you.
Oh, are you sure? I mean, she has two eyes, you have two eyes.
I know, we seem like a perfect match, but I just don't feel that way about her.
Look's like everybody's got somebody. Except me.
What was that?  Oh, my God! We're heading straight into a black hole.
Talk about a mood killer!
OK. We just have to get from here to the escape pods.
(shouting) I'm too young to die!
Come on, before its too late!
You all go without me. I'm gonna take one last look around. You know, for, uh, stuff to steal.
You're going back or the Countess, aren't you?
(whispering) Alright, I am. But I don't want the others to know. If I don't come back, just say I died robbing some old man.
I'll tell them you went out prying the wedding ring off his cold, dead finger.
(shouting) Countess? Countess?
(shouting) Are you hurt, my sweet?
Just hang on! I'll take care of that fire!
And I'd do it again. And perhaps a third time. But that would be it.  When we kiss, I feel like I'm standing waist deep in a pool of cold, rising water.
Hurry! The escape pods should be just ahead!
It won't move. And the door release is on the other side.
Then we're dead meat. No one could squeeze under there!
Wait a second. Aren't you a member of the yacht club?
Thank God there are plenty of escape pods; We won't have to dress up like women and children.
We can't leave yet. We've got to wait for Bender. The high gravity must be slowing down his looting.
Look! It's our nebula. Whenever I see it I'll think back to that moment when we almost--  Never mind!
I don't know. But we can't wait any longer.
(shouting) Wait for us!
Something's wrong. We're two metric tons overweight.
I can't live without you. If you let go, I let go!
Don't talk like that. Tragic romances always have a happy ending.
But she saved all our lives. Without her, we're light enough to get away.
Don't cry, Bender. Nobody really knows what happens in a black hole. It's possible she's still alive in another dimension somewhere. Right, Professor?
Oh, yes, absolutely!  Not a chance!
At least I'll always have her bracelet! What do you think it's worth?
Good news, everyone.  We've got a very special delivery today.
No, I need it shipped to my office at Mars University.  It's a little experiment that may well win me the Nobel Prize.
I don't care, they all pay the same.
Oh, my, no.  Off we go!
Very impressive. Back in the 20th century we had no idea there was a university on Mars.
Well, in those days Mars was just a dreary, uninhabitable wasteland, uh, much like Utah. But unlike Utah, it was eventually made livable, when the university was founded in 2636.
They planted traditional college foliage: ivy, trees, hemp. Soon the whole planet was terraformed.
Does that mean it's safe to breathe the air?
Over here is Wong Library. It has the largest collection of literature in the Western universe.
Hey look. There's a chapter of my old robot fraternity; Epsilon Rho Rho.
Of course, I'm a bender. I went to Bending College. I majored in Bending.
Uh, no, actually I'm an Epsilon from way back.
Thanks. Here's your finger back.
All the coolest robots are in this fraternity.
You're all losers. My name's Bender.
(modest) Yeah, well, a lot of 'em were children. Anyway I should get going.
Hmm, OK. But I'll need 10 kegs of beer, a continuous tape of Louie Louie and a regulation two-storey panty-raid ladder.
I tell you, being here really takes me back to my college days.
Good old Coney Island College! Go Whitefish!
Don't take this the wrong way, Fry, but you don't seem like the educated type.
Oh, yeah?  Read it and weep. I'm a certified college dropout.
Please! Everyone knows 20th century colleges were basically expensive daycare centres.
That's true. By current academic standards, you're merely a high school dropout.
What?! That's not fair. I deserve the same respect any other college dropout gets. By God, I'm gonna enroll here at Mars University and drop out all over again!
You won't last two weeks.
Aww, thanks for believing in me.
Oh, I don't know.  Hey, Professor, what are you teaching this semester?
Same thing I teach every semester: The mathematics of quantum neutrino fields. I made up the title so that no student would dare take it.
Mathematics of wanton burrito meals. I'll be there!
Please, Fry, I don't know how to teach; I'm a professor!
Oh, yeah! Someone's been a bad computer! Get a load of that!
Hey, pretty nice for a single. Two desks, two chairs, a couple of beds.  A woodpecker.
I think that's probably your roommate.
Oh, right, cool. (shouting) C'mon in, roomie!  (talking) What the--?
My roommate's a monkey?
Ah, Fry, I see you've met Guenter!
Guenter is my experiment. He was the top secret contents of this stinking crate.
So what makes Guenter talk?
Is he genetically engineered?
Oh, please! That's preposterous science-fiction mumbo-jumbo. Guenter's intelligence actually lies in his electronium hat which harnesses the power of sunspots to produce cognitive radiation.
I understood the word "hat"!
Please, stop bickering. I arranged that you be roommates for a reason: So I'd only have to remember one phone number. Now shake hands and make up.
This is gonna be a cakewalk!
I'm from the 20th century. Go ahead, ask me anything.
Ooh ... I know this ... whatyya call it? Lite Brite!
Hey, dean, nice looking model.
Now, I can explain that.
So, Chrissy, we seem to be hitting it off. If you're not doing anything later might I escort you to a kegger?
And therefore, by process of elimination, the electron must taste like grapeade.
It's that obnoxious monkey. He kept me up all night with his constant thinking. Just thinking and thinking. He's trying to make me look like an idiot.
Don't be jealous. Without his special hat, Guenter might be no more intelligent than you.
Fry, that monkey is my most important experiment. If you two don't stop fighting I'll have you both neutered.
Oh, I'm glad you made it, Guenter because in honour of parents weekend I have a special surprise for you.
Now these monkeys I like!  What's that? You wanna come out?
What's that they're flinging at us?
Hey, uh, Guenter? Why don't you get up on the chandelier with your parents and I'll take a picture?
Well, looks like the party's winding down. Let's take a road trip to Tijuana and get Fatbot some action.
What you did to Guenter was cruel. At the risk of sounding like an after-school special, I think we learned who the real animal was today.
You mean peer pressure?
Look out! He's got a gun!
Hey, what's going on? I thought you didn't like bananas.
Hey, hey, cheer up. Not everyone turns out like their parents. I mean, look at me. My folks were honest hardworking people.
Besides, Guenter, you're not like other monkeys. You've got the hat.
That's so sad. I didn't even know monkeys could cry.
Look, Guenter, if you're so miserable here, maybe you should just go back to the jungle.
But he's not your father. That guy in the punch bowl was your father.
Look at him, I'm so proud.
Oh, I always feared he might run off like this. Why? Why? Why didn't I break his legs?
(crying) Oh, poor Guenter.
So he just ran away in the middle of the exam?
I'm afraid so. All he handed in was a paper smeared with faeces. He tied with Fry.
I guess he realised I was right when I told him to go back to the jungle.
You what? After I spent months slaving over a hot monkey brain?
Hey, don't blame me. You tried to force Guenter to be a human but he's an animal. He belongs in the wild. Or in the circus on one of those tiny tricycles. Now that's entertainment.
But Guenter's obviously better off being intelligent. Tell him, Leela.
Nuh-uh, I'm staying out of this. Now here's my opinion: What we should do is...
I said we'll go to the jungle and let Guenter decide once and for all.
Wow" The jungles on Mars look just like the jungles on Earth.
I see some movement up there. I think it's him.
Don't worry. They'll be fine once the tranquiliser wears off.
Professor, you'll offer Guenter the hat and, Fry, you'll offer him the banana. We'll let him choose whether he wants to be intelligent or just a mindless animal.
Come on, Guenter, take the hat.
No, the banana, the banana!
Consider the philosophical and metaphysical ramifications of the--
Banana, banana, banana!
Wait, what's that sound?
(shouting) Not as sure as I was an hour ago!
Thank God this log is sturdy.  (shouting) Put on the hat, Guenter! You're the only one who can save us!  (muttering) Stupid monkey.
(shouting) Help us, Guenter!
Oh, no! Hurry, Guenter, climb up the vine. You can still save yourself.
Oh, that poor, sweet monkey. Well lets go gather him up. There's no sense letting him go to waste.
It seems to be working at only half-capacity, but I can fix it.
But what about your super-intelligence?
(shouting) Come on, everyone! Big party in Robot House!
Pizza delivery! Wow, so this is a real TV station, huh?
What are you showing right now?
Ah, I dunno. That's a chick show. I prefer programmes of the genre "world's blankiest blank".

Ow! Hey, quit it, Hermes. It's Labor Day.
Who's up for one last summer beach trip?
(unenthusiastic) Eh, I think I'll just stay here.
Fry, you're wasting your life sitting in front of that TV. You need to get out and see the real world.
But this is HDTV. It's got better resolution than the real world!

It varies from person to person.

That's the only ingredient of Slurm.
I'll save us!  Oh, that feels good!

To the ends of the universe.
This is awesome! We're gonna be like pow-pow-pow, and they're gonna be like ...  ... and then we'll have pancakes to celebrate and I'll be like...

Pft. Bodies are for hookers and fat people! All I need is a wad of cash with a head wrapped around it.
Well, at least now you can pay off your loan shark.
Yeah, right. What's he gonna do, break my legs?
Ah, this is the life. Another martini, please.
Shaken, not stirred.  Aw, yeah!
Yes! The rich get richer!
Strike! In your face, Leela!  Ow!
Hey, Bender, can I take a ride in your car?
Maybe if you clean up first. It looks like your neck stepped in something. Oh, I'm sorry, that's just your body!
Hey! You look me in the shins and say that.

I've had it up to here with this place. I'm off to the Head Museum to hang out with classy heads like me who appreciate the finer things: poetry, philosophy, hats. So long, coffin stuffers.  Uh, could one of you coffin stuffers please carry me?
Now, which group of heads is good enough for me to hang out with? What do you think, Fry? Fry?
I recognise you. Didn't you used to have a body of some sort?
Well, you're looking great.
Ah, US presidents.  Sturdy shelves, good security.  This place has class.
(to Clinton) Hey, I remember you. I was gonna vote for you one time. But voting isn't cool so I stayed home alone and got trashed on Listerine.
So then the hookerbot says, "That's not my expansion slot" and my friends says, "That's not my gold-plated 25-pin connector!"
You know, I like it here. What's the rent on one of these jars?
Same reason you hocked your teeth.
I hear that. I spent most of my teen years loving my body. Course, it was tough love but -- ooh!
Fry, he opened up relations with China. He doesn't want to hear about your ding-dong.
So, Nixon. Even if you miss your body, being a head's great too, right?
Oh, great. Now you tell me!
(sleep-talking) Ones...zeros...one, one, zero, zero, one --
Whoa, what an awful dream. Ones and zeros everywhere. And I thought I saw a two.
It was just a dream, Bender. There's no such thing as two.
I know what this is about. My body loved me, and I turned its back on it. Well, old friend, tie a yellow ribbon round your neck, 'cause I'm a-comin' home!
You sold my body? To who?!
Hey, my clothes are worth 50 bucks!
(crying) Oh! How could I let this happen? I can't go through the rest of my life like this.
Don't you have a self-destruct button?
(crying) Yeah, but it's on my body. What am I gonna do?
Ah, I can't stand to see a robot cry. Let's watch TV!
Bender, he's got your body!
That dirty, double-crossing bastard! How dare he run off with Richard Nixon!
Nixon must have bought your body from the pawn shop.
Yeah, and that electric guitar.
Yeah you are, you stole my body! Fry, Leela, you gotta help me!
Ordinarily I'd say no and lecture you on how this is your own fault for being such an idiot. But when a robotic Nixon is on the loose, we have a duty to take action. Idiot.
Great. First he steals my body, now he's touching my stuff.
Come on. We've gotta find some way to talk to him.
Give me my body back you two-bit thief!
Please, Mr. Nixon. We're appealing to your sense of decency.
(crying) It's hopeless. We might as well turn in my head for the five cent deposit.
No way! I'm not letting my best friend get recycled. Not for five cents, not for five hundred cents! Leela, I've got a plan!
I've got a better plan.
(whispering) Why would Nixon stay at the Watergate?
(whispering) They give you a discount if you've been here before.
Keep going, we're right behind you.
Whoa, mama! Get a room, you two!
Well then lose some weight.
(whispering) Psst! There I am!
OK, almost got it. Steady. Steady. Don't panic.
I'm just here for what's mine. Don't make me kick your neck.
Alright, break it up, you two!
You'll never pardon anybody because you'll never get elected president. The voters of Earth aren't the pea-brained idiots they were back in your time.
Not so fast, Nixon! Are you familiar with audio tape?
The jig's up, Nixon. We'll trade you the tape for the body.
Hey, I've got one last thought.
Ah, it's good to be back in one piece again. Except I can't get these damn bumper stickers off.
Why would robots vote for Nixon now that he's just a head in a jar?
I can't believe it. He won by a single vote.
Well it ain't my fault. I'm a non-voting felon, thank you.
Well it's not my fault either 'cause I forgot to vote.
Oh, crud. I knew there was something I meant to do today.
No. they fixed that 900 years ago.
Ah, lets face it: Comedy's a dead art form. Now tragedy ...  ... That's funny!
Come on, everyone. Perhaps some skiing will help us forget the mouldy old antics of Conan O'Brien.
This snow is beautiful. I'm glad global warming never happened.

Enough of your mindless chitchat, let's get going.
Look out! We're heading straight for those trees!
Yeah, yeah, relax. Trees down.
Cool. Hey what do you do if you want the trees up?
Lookin' good, meatball!
Lick my frozen metal ass.  Uh-oh!

Oh, what the hell!  Ow!

Yeah, it really puts you in the Christmas spirit.
Christmas. You know? X-M-A-S.

Hey, hey. Let me aks you something: Would it cheer you up if we went and cut down an Xmas tree?
Yeah! An old-fashioned Xmas tree!

They're supposed to be some kinda, you know, pine tree.
Pine trees have been extinct for 800 years, Fry. Gone the way of the poodle and your primitive notions of modesty. Ah! Brisk!
This isn't the way Christmas is supposed to be.
Xmas tree oh Xmas tree! Bah boo bee boo bah bee boh.

To volunteer at a liquor kitchen for homeless robots.

(from inside) Get her purse!

Uh, you're present may need some assembly.

(shouting) Somebody help us.

(shouting; from outside) Help!
(shouting; from outside) Help!
(shouting; from outside) Help!

Quick! The armour-plated chimney cover! Push! Push!

Watch out! His belly is shaking like a bowl full of nitro-glycerine!
(shouting) He's gonna blow.
Yes, good thing I got us out of that one!
Uh, Bender? Where did you get that bird?
I found it lying in the street, like all the food I cook. Dig in, everyone.
You got the toenail!  Oh!

He knows when you're on the can.

Mmm. Mmm! Now this is what I call a thousand years of progress: A Bavarian creamdog that's also self-microwaving!

Look at you guys. No offence, Fry, but you've become a fat sack of crap.
Come on. We're taking you pigs to the gym.
Co-ed steam rooms! I love the future!
Uh, Fry, you're in the womens' steam room.
Those poor 20th century women.
Hey, Leela, look who's the super-stud!
Hmm, somebody must have turned down the gravity. I'll fix it for you.
Hey, Dr. Zoidberg, what's that jazz on your head?
Maybe you could do more rips with less weight.
Hey, looks like Zoidberg's finally coming out of his shell.  Get it?  He's coming out--
I wonder why Dr. Zoidberg is acting this way. Out of all of us he always seemed the most normal.
Maybe he has a parasite.
It's always so sad when a friend goes crazy and you have to have a big clam-bake and cook him! Yee-haw!
Now, now, this won't do. Let me just give old Zoidy a sedative.
(simultaneously) No, Amy!
Mm-hm...  Oh-ho!  Aha! There's the problem.
Relax, my chiton-y chum. There's no problem. You're just heavy with male jelly.
It must be mating season for Zoidberg's people. A chaotic time when his behaviour is dictated by the tiny brain in his rump.
There's only one thing we can do...
I'll get the water boiling!
...We, by which I mean you, will have to rush him to his ancient homeworld which will shortly erupt in an orgy of invertebrate sex.
Fry, do you even understand the word "invertebrate"?
Nope, but that's not the word I'm interested in. (shouting) Uh, no need to pack pants, people. Let's roll!
Is that how you say "Zoidberg"?
You're looking less nuts, crabby.
Who's the lucky lobsterina?
It's amazing that your people can fall in love so fast.
You and me both, brother!
Look! Outdoor theatre! Let's get tickets. Oh, let's do!
I didn't come here to see any activity involving two guys. Where do you people do your erotic display?
Hey, I wonder if these guys are here to watch the erotic display too.
Look how ridiculous they look.
Please, he's no different from the rest of you organisms; Shooting DNA at each other make babies. I find it offensive.
Why is Zoidberg the only one still alone?
'Cause he's a loser, that's why. He's the lobster equivalent of Fry.
Hey! I can get any girl I want anytime I want. I'm just too busy.
At least you didn't smell as bad as them.
Listen, Doc, if you wanna score you gotta fake like you're in love.  Just look her in the eye, start crying and say (fake crying) "I've never been so happy".
If a guy ever did that to me I'd know it. Wait a second. They've all been doing that to me. Even Sean!
OK, you're on a date. What's the first thing you do?
No. Tell her she's special.
Well, tell her that. And then?
No. Make up some feelings and tell her you have them.  Yes?
You're not even trying!
OK, OK, don't worry. The love meister will take you under his wing.
(whispering) You just wanna talk, it has nothing to do with mating.
(whispering) Start with a compliment: Tell her she looks thin.
(whispering) Now ask her how her day was.
(whispering) You wouldn't. Ask anyway.
(whispering) That's normal. Just nod your head and say "Uh-huh"

So I returned his artificial heart and ever since then I've been known by the name of Honest Bender.
(whispering) Turn it over.

Nope. Must be some weird alien emotion.

No thanks. I just came to tell you that Zoidberg's really great. He's got male jelly coming out the wazoo.

Dr. Zoidberg, it's not how it looks.
Dr. Zoidberg, this is madness. You're being irrational.
Right, right.  You have to stop this madness.

Fry, I've never asked you for anything before but if it's not too much trouble, when it comes to the ninth round just let him win.
But it's a fight to the death!
Oh, so this is suddenly all about you. Sheesh!
(shouting) Come on, Fry! Die with dignity!
Psst, Fry. Take a dive.

My fellow fish monsters. Far be it for me to question your stupid civilisation or its dumb customs. But is squeezing each others brains out with a giant nutcracker really going to solve anything? Dr. Zoidberg is my friend. And though a woman has come between us, I say we'll always remain friends. And you know why?  One reason.
You bastard! I'll kill you! You bastard!
Wait! Stop! Everyone is gone.
Shoo! Get away! Hey! What's with the flying jerks?
You mean you have to choose between a life without sex and a gruesome death?
I don't mean to nitpick, super-doc, but do you think maybe you could take one more whack at this?
Mind if I tag along? I gotta bring my ass in for servicing.  The recall notice says it could burst into flames in a low-speed collision.
No wonder you've been staying at the back of conga lines lately.
I'll get my coat. Let's go, Bender.
Uh-huh. Now tell us she's witty and sophisticated.
Yup, she's beautiful coffee alright.
Sorry, I'm not here to buy.
I care! I care plenty! I just don't know how to make them stop!
You, sir, have defaced a national treasure! I demand you restore my buttocks to their former glory.
OK, the sticker says 55,000 but we'll only go as high as say--
Amy, you don't go up from the sticker price.
Hermes. Who were you yelling at?
Valentine's Day's coming? Oh, crap! I forgot to get a girlfriend again. Well since neither of us has a date, why don't we...
You just assume I can't get a Valentine's date?
Shall we say 8 o'clock?
Yeah, OK. What's the weather like?
Boy, this A.C. is incredible!  I'd better turn on the heater too.  (shouting) Boy, this heater is incredible! I'd better turn up the A.C. some more.
(shouting) Yeah!  We're slowing down!
(shouting) Who wants pop-tarts?  Uh-oh!
Hey, tell me something: You've got all this money, how come you always dress like you're doing your laundry?
I've been there. My folks were always on me to groom myself and wear underpants. What am I, the Pope?
Yeah, it's like we feel the same way about junk and stuff, or, whatever.
And it led there again when we got home.
Congratulations, Fry, you snagged the perfect girlfriend. Amy's rich, she's probably got other characteristics.
Bender! Romance isn't about money.
Oh, so it's just coincidence that Zoidberg here is desperately poor and miserably lonely? Puh-lease!
For your information, it's because he's hideous.
Do I hear wedding bells?
Wait. You mean people will pay good money for romance? Hmm. I think I have a scheme so deviously clever that I--
Stupid anti-pimping laws.  Well, pay the man!
Shut up, baby, I know it!
Ah, computer dating. It's like pimping but you rarely have to use the phrase "upside your head".
Bender, this is stupid. Why would anyone come to you for romantic help?
Hey! Don't make me go upside your head!
(whispering) It's working, they think we're making out.  Wait, why aren't we making out?
Just check off the things you're looking for in a love partner.
Now to run it through our high speed romance-a-logical data-fier.  Say hello to Miss Right!
Wow! We're great kissers!
Hey, yeah! I used to spit at stuff back in the 20th century. Ah, it's cool how we sort of think exactly alike, and junk.
Everything was going great. Then all of a sudden, she's talking about hanging out. Hangin out? She's getting way too serious. I'm not a one woman man, Leela.
You'll be back to zero soon enough.
Don't you get it? She's smothering me.
You see? You see? Now she's bothering me when I'm at work.
I'm doing my job -- there's Amy. I spend a few hours selecting a candy from the machine -- there's Amy. I wake up the morning after sleeping with Amy -- there's Amy!
I think you're over reacting.
Am I? (shouting) Am I? (talking) Face it, I'm a prize catch.  I mean, I'm pulling down delivery boy money.
Fry, she's pulling down billionaire trust-fund money.
Then she wants me as a trophy husband. Leela, you gotta come to Europa with us, I can't be alone with her.
Hey, you know who loves secluded picnics with just you and me?  Uh, Dr. Zoidberg.
Jeez, we're already planning to spend Valentine's Day together. Isn't that enough?
Oh, so all of a sudden we're spending Valentine's Day together?
That's it, Amy, we have to talk. Zoidberg, you drive.
(from inside) Pardon me, excuse me.
Amy, you know how at first you like chocolate but then you start to get tired of it because it always wants to hang out with you?
Look, could chocolate just let me finish?
Amy, what I'm trying to say is, I think maybe you and I should stop--
Ow! My head is killing me. What happened? Was anybody hurt?
This sort of thing always happens with office romances.
Well, Amy, I'll try not to interfere with your life too much.
Ooh, sorry. I guess I control that arm.
Oh, that.  Maybe we'd better talk in private. (whispering) I'll meet you in the closet.
Amy, I really like you, as a friend. But I think we're spending too much time together.
I just think we should start seeing other people.
Hey, I can get a date too. Now that I'm single, I'll attract all sorts of women!
(happy) Oh! (disappointed) Oh!
Are you familiar with my friend Al Gore? I'm tellin' ya, losers get really desperate around Valentine's Day.
Yeah, it's pathetic alright!  How much?
Oh, hey, Leela, uh, can I talk to you for a minute?  In private?
This is an emergency. Amy made Valentine's plans with some goon and I'm gonna be stuck there, lonely and miserable. Will you be my date, please?
You're too late, Fry. I'm sharing Valentine's Day with a very special man. He's not Zapp Brannigan or anything!
Then I have no choice but to do something so pitiful and embarrassing that I'm ashamed to tell you about it.
Bender's in his office.
I got your hook-up, Fry. Now my usual fee's 500 bucks, but seeing as how it's you, I'll need it in advance.
Why exactly did you shave your legs anyway? Are you expecting something to happen with your Valentine's date?
And another thing: You're using an awful lot of make-up there.
20 minutes? You're practically ready now!
(simultaneously) Thanks.  Where is she?
I've got a date. She'll be along any minute.
Fry, look who I found! It's Petunia, your dream girl!
(whispering) She seems a little old for me.

Now how about a rose for the lady? Five bucks a pop!

Demand suddenly skyrocketed, you all saw it.
Leela, meets your future husband Sal.

Wait, come back, uh, darling.
(whispering) Bender! Did you just round up our dates at the bus station?
Hey, I have an idea: Let's all go out for ice cream.
Nooo!  That's it I'm gettin' the hell outta here.  Ooh! Ow!
Why, if it isn't my favourite head on Amy's body: Fry.
Nonsense, the evening's young. So, Gary, what do you do for a living?
Really? Y'know I heard that banking industry regulations are really very simple.
I still don't understand why you wouldn't let me graft a laser cannon onto your chest. To crush those who disobey you. But I guess we're just two different people.
So, uh, thanks for the ride, Amy. And I hope there are no hard feelings about your date, or stuff.
Well, anyway, it's nice to have my own body back.
So how's the old corpse? Everything hooked up OK?
Seems to be. My neck's just a little tender.  Ow! Cool!  Ow! Listen, Leela. Thanks for rescuing me last night.
Anytime. I actually enjoyed hanging out with you.
Yep, everything worked out great thanks to good old Bender.
Come on! It's not like you intentionally set us up with bad dates so we'd spend Valentine's Day together.
Didn't I, Leela? Didn't I?
No! You didn't! You just corralled a bunch of stiffs at the bus station and pocketed our money!

I guess so.  Watch the neck! Watch the neck!
My ass! My beautiful ass!

Nah. If I ever wanna go back to the year 2000 I'll just freeze myself again.

It says he was mummified in ceremonial vestments.

Hey, my girlfriend had one of those! Actually it wasn't her's it was her dad's. Actually she wasn't my girlfriend. She just lived next door and never closed her curtains.

Nope.  No one in New York drove. There was too much traffic.  Nice! Listen to that baby purr!
There's a baby in there huh?
It's just like riding a bicyc -
I think I got whiplash.
You can't have whiplash, you don't have a neck.

Leela, Zoidberg, the rest of you, this is Flexo.
Hey brobot, what's you serial number?
No way! Mine's 2716057!
We're both expressable as the sum of two cubes.

Well just let me know if there's anything I can do to make it up to you.
Uh I can't get any lower than this.
