Shut up and hoot.  Hubba-hubba, she is built! In Mexico I believe.
(unsure) Uh, yeah. Look at that exhaust fan.
Uh, no, that's alright.  Ow! Ow!
I'm telling you there's something about Flexo I don't like.
Yeah keep laughing brineshrimp but he's bad news. I regret ever running him over.
He's much worse. He drinks, he smokes and he posts naked pictures of me on the internet.
I'm talking about Flexo.
Oh I get it, this is cute. You're jealous of Bender's new friend!
No I'm not. Mark my words. Flexo's evil. He's the evil Bender.
Everyone get in bed with me. I have something to show you.  Feast your eyes on this!
It's a single atom of jumbonium. And element so rare, the nucleus alone is worth more than $50,000.
100,000. That's why I hid it here. Under my mattress.
Uh Professor, can we discuss this somewhere else?
The atom sits atop this dime stored tiara which will be awarded to the winner of this years Miss Universe pageant on the planet Tova 9.  Your job is to deliver it, safe and sound.
Due to the atom's tremendous value, Planet Express would go bankrupt if it was stolen. Therefore we'll need to hire on additional security for the mission.
Uh, maybe we should stick with people we know and trust. I mean, Flexo's great but -
Flexo's great you say? Well that's good enough for me.  Welcome aboard lad.
Space banditos have been operating in this quadrant so you'll each take 8-hour shifts guarding the safe. First Bender, then Flexo, then Fry.
Wait, I don't like the sound of that. Let's just go alphabetically.
OK. First Bender, then Flexo, then Fry.
Wait, let's go by rank.
OK. First Bender, then Flexo, then Fry.
Don't point that at me.
Look, I know Flexo's your friend but I don't trust him alone with the atom.
My God Fry just 'cause the guy's got a beard you label him as evil? Well I got a label for you pal. An ugly little word called "prejudice."
Ah save it for the cross burning Adolf!
Caught you!  I saw you looking at the atom!
Oh-ho you'd like it if I went to sleep wouldn't you?
Yeah well here's a funny joke. I'm gonna sit right here till it's my shift.
Well, that's eight hours.
Finally, the atom is safe.
What is it?  My God! Did you hear maracas?
Then it wasn't space banditos.  Bender, lock down the ship, don't let Flexo escape.
Aye aye captain. It appears that Flexo has outwitted us all. Especially me...Bender.
How could Flexo have stolen the atom?
He must have used a sleep ray on me. Sleep rays exist in the future right?
Then I must've fallen asleep.
Well you were sure right about Flexo being evil.
I locked down the ship but he may have already gotten away.
OK, thanks Bender. Let's fan out and look for him.
Roger that, I got a map of the ship right here.
(whispering) Keep an eye on Fry. We can't rule out the possibility that he did it.
Aha!  Uh searching...hmm.
Fry? Why are you looking for Flexo in my underpants drawer?
I didn't find him here 10 minutes ago so I thought it was time to check again.
Well, he wasn't in the uh, kitchen room.
(suspicious) Say Bender, can I hold that map for a second?
Any leave me high and dry in case of a scavenger hunt? I think not.
Alright, take it. Sheesh.
Well, looks like Flexo got away clean.
He must have jumped ship with the atom the second we landed.
Or maybe, he never left at all!  Wait a minute. You're Bender.
Of course, who said I wasn't?
But why were you wearing that scarf, that turtleneck and this fruity number?
It's a little thing called "style." Look it up sometime.
(whispering) Downplay the tiara.
Well, we'll be leaving now. If you'll just sign this form saying you received the atom.
Well gentlemen, it appears we're boned.
Shoot him, he's choking me!
I don't know which one to shoot.
Alright, enough of this.  There's the atom!
Bender? You stole the atom?
Yeah but I can explain, it's very valuable.
Whoa whoa, you mean Bender is the evil Bender? I am shocked, shocked! Well not that shocked.
I'm sorry we suspected you Flexo. It's just, what with the beard and all.
I'm so confused. The Bender I liked turn out to be evil and the Bender I hated was good. How can I live my life when I can't tell good from evil?
Eh, they're both fine choices, whatever floats your boat.
It figures. Who else but Zapp Brannigan would be judging the most chauvinistic, degrading, dehumanising -
Wait, you're making a -  Ooo! Look at that.  I feel like a princess.
I almost had that tiara.
Well, you guys might both be losers but I just made out with that radiator woman from the radiator planet.
Fry, that's a radiator.
Oh.  Is there a burn ward within 10 feet of here?
Good news, everyone. I've taught the toaster to feel love.  And Hermes returns from his vacation today.
Hermes has all the fun. Wait a second! He's got a Brain Slug on his head!
(whispering) Shh! You're gonna get us all assimilated!
Sounds great, Hermes! Whatever you say. (whispering) Let's ditch him and go to the movies!
Cool, let's see this one!
Nah. I'm not in the mood for a historical documentary. I've heard good things about Quizblorg, Quizblorg.
Who invited you? Let's just see All My Circuits: The Movie.
Yeah, I wanna see that.
I'll take a small Slurm.
Hey, gimmie a large diet malt liquor and a popcorn with extra motor oil.
(sarcastic) Ooh, this is real futuristic!
(shouting) Go Masked Unit!  Uh, hey, buddy! Yo!  You mind taking your head off?
Just ask Flabby over here to describe it to you later.
Well they should have stopped making her about halfway through.
(mocking) "Pardon me, sir. But you seem to be bleh bleh..."
(fake shocked) Who threw that?!
Bender, do you know who that was?
You should see me at funerals.
Ultimate Robot Fighting? Sounds pleasant! I'll do it.
Aw. They don't make movies like this anymore.
I'm gonna be the greatest Ultimate Robot Fighter ever. Float like a floatbot, sting like an automatic stinging machine!
There are no rules. Two robots enter, one robot leaves. Then later the other robot leaves after being declared the winner.
Well, that doesn't sound so bad.
Oh, did I mention the crippling, agonising pain? I'm pretty sure I did. Oh, yes, definitely.
Crippling pain? That's not covered by my insurance fraud! Count me out.
No! You've got to do it. I don't care how suicidal it is.
Hey! How come when I wanna do fun stuff that'll kill me you're against it?
This is more important than that marble-eating contest, Fry! It's about pride. Let me tell you a story from my childhood.
When I was growing up at the orphanarium, I got picked on a lot...
(voice-over) ...My only outlet was Arcturan Kung Fu.
But, Master Fnog, I can beat these dorks with one eye closed.
What do you mean? Watch this!
That's it. I'll take you on right now.
I lost my chance to be a champion. I won't let you throw away yours.
Leela's right! I don't wanna end up a loser like her. Count me back in!
Let's see what you got. Touch your toes.
Still ... can't ... reach!
Let's commence preparations for rumbling!
(shouting) Bender rules!
Wow! Thanks, Hermes!  I-- Hey! Cut that out!
You can't hit what you can't see!
Get up, Bender. You can't quit every time you get an axe in the back.  Or a drill through your face. Now quit scratching your axe-hole and get out there.
Y'know, I think I he might be dead. I took a life!
Hey, he's not dead. What's up with that?
You mean I'm not a great fighter? I just won 'cause I'm popular?
Go Bender! Go Bender! Go Bender!
I'm just an ex-con trying to go straight and get my kids back.
You know, I'm also an Ultimate Robot Lover.
Bender! You're three hours late. You can't give up on your training now after both of us worked so hard.
What do you mean, "we"?
Hey, Bender the Offender doesn't need you. Bender the Offender doesn't need anybody!
Well obviously I need floozies! Let's roll!
Howdy, chief. For my next bout, what do you say I fight these two bimbos in some mud?
What if I told your we wouldn't be fighting in the conventional sense?
Those morons! I said pea berry, not sandalwood!
But the crowd loves me.
Oh, yeah?  Well what if I don't let the new guy win?
(squeaky) See you at the fight.
So then I said, "See you at the fight". And that's the story.
Man, I thought Ultimate Robot Fighting was real, like pro wrestling. But it turns out it's fixed, like boxing.
It's one thing to win a fixed fight -- there's dignity in that. But to lose? And in this atrocity? I can't do it! Leela, you gotta train me to win.
No way! If you wouldn't take my help when you didn't need it, why should I give it to you now when you do need it?
What the hell are you talking about?
I don't know. But I'm not helping.
Not Fnog! Bender, let's hit the gym. I'm gonna teach you to fight like a girl!
(determined) I'll put on my tutu!
According to the script, you're supposed to prance out and tickle him with your fairy wand. Instead, I want you to prance out and kick his head off!
Got it. Large kickle, hold the tickle!
Sorry, buddy. Here you go!
Oh, good. Just let me put on my reading glasses.  Why, Zoidberg, there's a lovely photo of you in here.
Keep laughing, Fnog!  Ready, Bender?
I was born ready! Gimmie the bell! Did you hear a noise?  Final boarding call for flight 406, non-stop service to pain.  Now boarding standby passengers--
(weakly) Fry! Throw in the towel!  For God's sakes, Fry!
OK, Fnog, that's enough. Call him off. Fnog?  Hmm.
Why won't anyone help me?
So, once more we meet again.
You didn't train Destructor. You're just controlling him like a puppet. I mean, cheating in a fake fight. That's low!
(ironic) Oh, right. Girls lack the will of the warrior!
Huh? It's bendering time!  Take this. And this!
I think you misunderstood the concept of "bendering time"!
Bender? How did the fight go? I heard somebody got flattened!
Poor little guy starved to death.
I'm proud of you, Bender. Sure, you lost. You lost bad. But the important thing is I beat up someone who hurt my feelings in high school.
I'm in tremendous pain here.
Yes! I'm the greatest! The greatest!
Good news everyone! Several years ago I tried to log on to AOL, and it just went through! Wheee! We're online!
Go ahead! Get into these net suits. I designed and tested them myself.
It smells like burning recess monkey.
Really? I guess when you're around it all day you stop noticing. Off you go.
My God! It's full of ads!
It's got every piece of information anyone could ever want.
No it isn't. I just took some pictures of your face and stuck them on someone else's body.
I'm telling you Fry they've got a chatroom for everybody. And here it is.
Yeah. I'll stick with this one thank you.
Hi, I'm a naughty nurse and I really need someone to talk to. 9.95 a minute.
So how 'bout them Knicks?
I'm a woman if that's what you mean. I don't like to play games so I'll just say I'm a cyclops, I'm a spaceship captain, I'm the only one of my species and I'm interested in meeting a man.
Well, thanks to the internet, I'm bored with sex. Is there a place on the web that panders to my lust for violence?
Is the space pope reptilian?
We call it a "video game."
Uh, "video game" you say? Well golly gee, you mighty spacemen of the future will have to show me how it works.
Everyone please sign off, we have a delivery. Plus I have to use the phone -  Leela please tell the others that -
I can't believe it. I've dreamed of this moment all my life.

Fry, you idiot. Ever since I was abandoned on Earth I've been searching for who my people are and where they come from. Then I finally meet another Cyclops and you blast him. You wrecked my one chance to learn who I am.
Oh Leela. I feel terrible. If there's anything I can ever do -  Gotcha!  I won! I'm the greatest!
Come on. We have worked to do.
Are you still mad at me for wrecking your once in a lifetime chance to learn the meaning of your existence?
No, I'm just happy you were able to win a video game. Now lets concentrate on getting this desperately needed popcorn to the people of Cineplex 14 OK?
Too bad we gotta make that urgent popcorn delivery.
After a whole life of searching I may finally have found where I belong.
Look at that statue. It's only got one eye.
Alkazar?  Are you real? Or am I seeing single?
After all this time. Somebody else with one eye who isn't a clumsy carpenter or, uh, a kid with a BB gun.
There's so much information and yet somehow I feel as if I know it all already.
Hmm, you got any sacred artwork of her from the back?
Is that anything like a cemetary 'cause I gotta take a leak.  Ow!
Fry, that's offensive to our people. Isn't it?
Oh no not at all. If anything, I'm more impressed.
Ooo! I'm gonna need to make some room!
It's all so sad. What happened to our people?
I heard you from my room. What's wrong?
Please, is it bout the fate of our people? Because I'm very interested in that.
Alkazar, I used to be a baby, it might have been me!
You're a male and I'm a female.
Uh, sure OK. What do you take with that?
Maybe after breakfast we can talk about rebuilding our civilisation.
Mmm! Great pancakes Leela!
Look Al. I know you've been living alone a long time and I can sympathise but I'm not your maid.
OK OK, I'll do the dishes.  Hey where'd they go?
Ah, Leela's experiencing the greatest joy a woman can feel: Worshipping some lowlife jerk.
He may be some lowlife jerk but I don't trust him. I think he's hiding something and I'm gonna find out what it is.
Al? I did my hair the way you wanted it.  Who are these people?
Hey, where'd you get this couch and that TV set and all this stuff?
Too bad they weren't giving away the three things you actually need: Mouthwash, a back wax and stain-proof underwear.
Come on Al, can't you let the little guy out?
Why were you sneaking into my people's forbidden valley?
'Cause I think Alkazar's hding something. Listen Leela, you may not like it, you may not believe it, you may not wanna hear it but Alkazar's a jerk, he's bad for you. He -
Fry if it's obvious to you with your learning disability then of course it's obvious to me! He's crude and gross and he treats me like a slave.
Then dump his one eyed ass.
I can't. If I leave Alkazar then that's the end of the Cyclops race. And I won't let that happen. Even if that means a lifetime of unhappiness.
I'll break up with him at dinner.
C'mon Leela you deserve better than this guy! Dump him already!
Pst, Leela. you've got to get me out of here. It's horrible, eating scraps, letting my waste drop wherever it falls like an animal in the zoo.
Animals go in the corner.
The corner! Why didn't I think of that?
Look Fry I'd like to help you but it's my wedding and I'm kind of busy.  Here, try to be happy for me. That way at least one of us will be.
That's it! It's time for this bird to walk.
Bender come on. We've got to get some dirt on Alkazar. Lets go and find out what makes the Forbidden Valley so forbidden.
But there's probably some cool forbidden stuff you can steal.
I don't know Fry. For the first time in my life I feel like I've stolen enough.
Bender, snap out of it!
Sorry I don't know what came over me. Let's go.  (singing) I love stealing, I love taking things!
Come on boy, jump!  Good boy!
My God! Four identical castles!
Each more identical than the last!
That's weird. It's another Cyclops, only this one has five eyes.
And here's another one with no eyes.
Saving a race of one-eyed monsters? Who could object to that?
Hey Alkazar, you left somebody off the guest list.
Oh yeah? Then what about this?
And maybe you'd like to meet her.  And her.
A little. That's why I've decided to hurt you until you explain it.
But why did you have all five weddings on the same day?
Alright Alkazar, I just have one last question for you.
If you can change form, why didn't you change it in the one place that counts?
Thanks for saving me from that creep Fry.
I guess I was so desperate to find out who I really was, I forgot who I really was.
No harm done. In the many decades you'll work to repay me for that shipment of popcorn you destroyed, you'll have plenty of time to search for your true home.
Yeah. I mean, how many planets can there be?
I'm having a poker game tonight with some friends from my old cryogenics job. You guys interested?
I don't know. I only gamble with chumps.
We're playing poker. but I'm warning you, my friends are serious players.
Wow, you look happy. Is someone fired?
Hermes, wait! We're having a poker party. Stay and whip off a batch of your famous jerk dip.
Jamaican? I thought you were some kinda outer space potato man.
Ah that must be my old boss.
But you never wore your ring. I didn't know you had a wife.
C'mon, let's deal. You'll have plenty of time to talk when you're poor.
What's with the specs Bender?
They're my lucky shades. I stole them off some lucky guy while his lucky seeing eye dog was taking a whiz.
It doesn't matter how many human females you have, Bender's on a hot streak.
Uh, what can I say? Must be my lucky shades!  Nothing, nothing, crap, crap, garbage.  Read 'em and leak saltwater!
If I were you I'd be more worried about that tapeworm going to town on your intestines.
Guys, I swear those are prescription. I need them for reading stuff - on the other side of stuff.
Uh, it was ghosts! Big ones! And a tornado!
Aw hey c'mon don't worry. We'll watch you clean up.
Jeez Hermes, you seem awfully calm about this.
Don't do it Hermes! You have so much to live for!
Fry got his head stuck in a crater.
I thought it would fit.
Martini drinking contests with the autopilot. I would've had him this time but we ran out of olives.
What is this, high school?
Hey, sometimes a guy gets lonely.
Uh, I can explain that. See, it used to be milk and, well, time makes fools of us all.
Uh wait, this is the other Fry's locker. I'm Phry with a "Ph."
What the hell's going on? I thought you were anti-dirty not pro-dirty.
Just like very other girl I've dated.
That's a full time job.
Bender, what happened to you?

Morgan made me walk the Professor. There we were in the park when suddenly some old lady says I stole her purse. I chucked the Professor at her but she kept on coming. So had to hit her with this purse I found. Ah, the point is it's Morgan's fault. That pencil pushing scazwag.  Why if she were here I'd - Uh oh is she behind me?
Uh wait, Bender's my rooommate. He could be back any second.

Hey Fry, I made you a candle with - What the?  Oh now I see! Now I get it. Now the pieces are falling into place. The office, the promotion, that dwarf in my book club who steals my opinions.  It's all coming together now!
I must say this opens my eyes! Another case closed my dear Watson.
Morgan, come back! He's stuck in a loop!
For I was blind but now I see!
The cat's out of the bag now!
Oh you didn't understand? Well let me explain. You......were having sex with you.

That's what makes it so juicy. Its the forbidden fruit angle everybody loves. First I'll say "You'll never guess who saw Fry and Morgan doing it!" and they'll say "Who Bender, who?" and I'll say "It was lovable......old Bender."
Hey, what did you do to him?
But, but...Bender need brain...for...smart making!  What did you do now? Stop doing things!
No, he was a bad friend. I want him back right now.
I'm sick of you and your bureaucracy.
You and Morgan were having an affair?
I couldn't help it. She loved me because of the part of me that's a slob and I loved her because of the part of me that's desperate.
Poor Bender. Without his brain he's become all quiet and helpful. We've got to go to the Central Bureaucracy and get that disk back!
Well, those arguments aside, we're still going.
You can't just waltz into the Central Bureaucracy. It's a tangled web of red tape and regulations. I've never been but a friend of mine went completely mad trying to find the washroom there.
Then we'll need a guide. Someone who's been there before.
Oh I've been there. Lot's of times!
Man, how long is this gonna take?
Well it doesn't look like I'll make it inside with the rest of you. Uh but good luck. Just leave me where I drop.
Come on, I have a better idea.
Excuse me? We're from the Planet Express delivery company. We're here to deliver a robot.
While you're crashing, could you tell us where all these canisters end up?
We're getting nowhere slowly. Here, I'll address this to the Central Filing room.  Then we'll track it using my wrist-lojack-amater.
This is it. We'll just run in, grab Bender's disk and run out. Got it?
We'll never find that disk will we Bender?
You're right. Nothing is over so long as there's one thin ray of hope.
Listen Morgan, We're through, you're an evil heartless woman and I never wanna see you again. However would you help us get Bender back for old times sake?
Dammit Hermes, just jump already. Stop hogging that healthy liver.
But how did you know we were here?
That's only four minutes from now.
They poo-pooed my electric frankfurter.
They said I probably shouldn't fly with just one eye.
I'm Bender baby, please insert liquor!
That's right, she fraternized me!
Well, it looks like I'll be needing my heroic bureaucrat back. At severely reduced pay of course.
What about me? Can I come back at severely reduced pay?
Good news everyone, the university is bringing me up on disciplinary charges! Wait, that's not good news at all.
Whatever you did Professor, I'm sure there's a reasonable explanation.
Yes but they won't listen. Everyone's always in favour of saving Hitler's brain but when you put it in the body of a great white shark (sarcastic) ooo, suddenly you've gone too far.

Listen to me you pompous frauds, if I'm going down, I'm taking you all with me. Dean Vernon, I know the truth. It was you driving your hover-car that night, not your horse. Dean Epsilon, I know all about your "Department Of Pool Boy Studies." And Dr Wernstrom...Werrrnstrom!
And you Coach Smalley, or should I say "Coach hairpiece"?
No Professor, it's a surprise party for your 150th birthday.
(muttering) Hundred and...what? Oooh!

Good evening I'm -  Whoa, sorry. I'm Bender and I'll be MC-ing this roast. Y'know, they say you can judge a man by the company he keeps, so here's the Professor's oldest friend: A grotesque, stinking lobster!

Where would the Professor be without students who love and respect him? Right there!  But seriously, of all the former crew members of the Professor's delivery ship, our next speaker is by far the most alive. Captain Muskie?
And now, a man who needs no introduction. (whispering) Fry, get up there!

Oh.  Thank you. Y'know, when I was first asked to make a film about my nephew, Professor Farnsworth, I thought "Why should I?" Then later Leela made the film. But if I had made the film, you could bet there would have been a lot more topless women on motorcycles! Roll film!
(whispering) Dork alert!
How 'bout a few words Professor?
Uh, what a pleasure it is to see my lifetime of accomplishments summed up in a 3-minute film. My best years are behind me. So much left undone. So little time.
No it isn't. You have another 10 years left.
Leela! He could live another 100 years!
No, he couldn't. When you turn 160, robots from the Sunset Squad take you to a mysterious planet and you never return.
Wow, a whole planet of old people. Where is it?
(spookily) Nobody knows!
So many loves half-loved. So many inventions half-invented. That damn time machine alone set me back 15 years.
There's no one to carry on after I'm gone. No one to take care of my work and my research and my fabulous fortune. By God, that's it! I've got to name a successor.
There's no time to lose. I'm off to my lab to build a successor-naming machine!
Man, the Professor's been in his lab for days.
I hope he didn't die. Unless he left a note naming me his successor. Then I hope he did die.
Look, the Professor trusts me with a giant spaceship. He wouldn't trust the rest of you with his dentures.
Sorry everyone but need I remind you? Blood is thicker than water.
Everyone, I have a very dramatic announcement. So anyone with a weak heart should leave now. Goodbye.
Oh yes, the announcement! As you all know, I am not long for this world...
...So I've picked my successor. It's someone in whom I have great faith - even though his mind is undeveloped and he's accomplished nothing.  My closest living relative...
My clone, Cubert Farnsworth.
Crud. Can I at least be in charge of your dentures?
Where did Cubert come from?
12 years ago I began the cloning process by removing some skin cells from one of the shaplier growths on my back.
Wait, if he's your clone then why doesn't his nose look like yours?
I left him in his first tube too long and he got squished up against the side.
Is he dumb or just ugly?
Well, once in the park.
Uh...me no speaka the English.
Im pending para un bending!
Oh Cubert, come in here. I have something amazing to show you.
As my successor I'm trusting you to carry on my work. These are just some of the half finished inventions you'll spend your life finishing.

That's my prizewinning smelloscope. If a dog craps anywhere in the universe, you can bet I won't be out of the loop. And this is my universal translator. Unfortunately so far it only translates into an incomprehensible dead language.
Why certainly. Step over here.
These are the dark matter engine I invented. They allow my starship to travel between galaxies in mere hours.
Of course not. That's why scientists increased the speed of light in 2208.
And what makes my engines truly remarkable is the afterburner which delivers 200% fuel efficiency.
Not at all. It's very simple.
Now that's impossible. It came to me in a dream and I forgot it in another dream.
Nothing is impossible. Not if you can imagine it. That's what being is a scientist is all about.
Oh my God, oh my God! It's Elzar, the TV chef! Oh kill me now people!
Oh Elzar, everything's so good!
Oh it's a gem of an evening! I feel so wonderful having someone to take over my life work! And it's all thanks to Cubert.
But-But what about my hopes and my dreams and my wonderful inventions?

Bad news everyone. By the time you watch this tape, I'll be gone. Leaving by nothing but a history of failure and my original hipbones. You see, I've been lying about my age. I'm not actually 150. I'm 160. Oh vanity, thy name is Professor Farnsworth. And now that I've nothing to live for, I've alerted the Sunset Squad robots to take me away.

Goodbye cruel world.  Goodbye cruel lamp.  Goodbye cruel velvet drapes, lined with what would appear to be some sort of cruel muslin......and the cute little pompom curtain pull cords, cruel though they may be a -
(unmoved) Well, life goes on. Except for you!
We've gotta get him back.
Nothing is impossible. You'd know that if you really took after the Professor, like I do.
Quiet. I think I know how to find the Professor.
Lay it on us big boots.
If the smelloscope can pick up the Professor's odour, we may have a chance to save him.
I'm zeroing in on him.  Bengay...mothballs......letters to the editor. It's the Professor!
To the left!  No to the up!  U-turn, U-turn!
No we're not you little bed wetter. Oops I'm sorry.
There it is! The Near-Death Star!
OK, we'll tell them the Professor escaped and we're bringing him back. Fry, you'll have to dress up like a 160 year old man.
Now they may ask for a DNA sample.
I'd like to see them find it!
I think I know where to get some.
'Cause you're too ugly to be a wart.
Your medicare dollars at work.
Uh, this is Professor Hubert Farnsworth. He escaped.
What? I'm old. Listen. (old man voice) Hey you kids, get off the lawn!
Got a hot steaming batch right here!
Eh, keep the change buddy.
Uh....I-I've got talking hump syndrome.
So this is where they stick old people. It's horrific.
At least it keeps them from driving.
Brace yourself for the worst.
And yet he looks so natural.
He's hooked up to a life-support system. We have to disconnect him very very carefully, or the shock could kill him.
We're probably going to make it, but we might not.
Come on Leela, step your big boot down on the gas pedal.
They've blown out one of our engines!
Fix it fix it fix it fix it fix it fix it! Fix it fix it fix it!
Only the Professor knows how to fix it. We have to wake him up.
(shouting) Your social security cheque is late! Stuff costs more than it used to. Young people use curse words!
Damnit, we'll have to fix the engine ourself.
We can't you bastard, no one knows how it works. It's impossible.
That's a complete load.
I'm as spry as a 140 year old.  See? I only broke one ankle.
So what were they doing to you in that awful drawer?
Oh, they had me hooked up to a bizarre virtual world that seemed absolutely real.
It was as though I was living in a facility in Florida with hundreds of other old people. All day long we'd play bingo, eat oatmeal and wait for our children to call.
It's a hundred times more horrible than anything I could imagine.
Oh my yes. Thank you all for saving me. Especially you my little clone. No matter what you decide to do with your life, I'm still proud of you.
Don't worry son. You will. Incidentally, you might want to read up on a condition known as "wandering bladder."
No reason. No reason at all.
Hermes, that's sweet. I didn't know you cared about Nibbler.
Ah! The exact centre of the Atlantic Ocean. This seems the logical place for fish to congregate.
So we're in international waters?
Falcon, this is Blue Raven, the goose has nested. Repeat, the goose has nested. Hey, guess what you're accessories to?
The sun, the sea air, good friends.
Leela's right, fishing blows. Whattya say we make it interesting?
Everybody kick in five bucks.  There, wasn't that interesting?
This contest is as good as over. I once caught a fish this big.
Oh, yeah? I once caught a fish this big!
I'm afraid you're both out of your league, boys, 'cause you're looking at a woman who owns her own harpoon.
Hey, Fry, check out my laser-guided fishing rod.
(whispering) Quiet, Bender, you're scaring away the fish.
Fine. I'll head over to the other side. (shouting) Good luck fishing on this side!
I can hit a fish between the eyes from 20 yards!
Oh, yeah? I can hit a shrimp!
A shrimp?  I find it a bit hard to believe that--
Aha!  Gather round, chumps! I got the winner!
Couple more of those and you'll have yourself a fish stick!
Hey, a fish this fine belongs in a fish nugget-style chunklet. And anyway, it's bigger than anything you've caught. Ow! My small intestine!
Bingo! Whatever it is, it's 20 times heavier than a boot.
You'll never catch anything with that primitive technology. What you need is this fish pheromone.  The most potent aphrodisiac known to fishkind.  Uh-oh!
(shouting) Hey, Bender, I just caught a fish this big!
Quit exaggerating, Fry. Ah, screw this! If I'm not gonna catch a fish, I might as well not catch a big fish.  There. Like most of life's problems this one can be solved with bending.
Bender, be careful. That's the ships diamond filament tether. It's unbreakable.
Then why do I have to be careful?
It belonged to my grandmother.
Wake up, everyone! I've got something. And this time it's alive!  Dr. Zoidberg, since when do you even wear boots?
Come on, let's go home.
I don't know. It wasn't here when I took your umbrella.  What? I put sunblock on you.
Come on, Bender. Pull in your line and let's go.
It's not snagged, the mechano man has caught something!  Sweet Zombie Jesus! It's huge!
It's pulling us under! Everyone into the ship!
Depth at 45 hundred feet, 48 hundred, 50 hundred! 5000 feet!
Dear Lord, that's over 150 atmospheres of pressure.
How many atmospheres can this ship withstand?
Well it's a spaceship, so I'd say anywhere between zero and one.
What's that? Is someone bending girders?
We'll be crushed if we don't equalise the pressure.
Wait, I'll be back in a minute.
People, it's far far worse than we thought; My fish got away.
There, good as new! Except we're three miles below the surface, we don't have any food and the ship won't work underwater.
(restrained) Tempers are wearing thin. Let's just hope some robot doesn't kill everybody.
OK, everyone, calm down. The Professor and I will get to work on the ship. Bender, Zoidberg, since you can survive underwater, you'll go out and look for food.
I'd better go too. They don't know what I like.
Not necessarily. This is chance for Fry to test out my experimental anti-pressure pill.
Well then good news! It's a suppository.
Ahoy, mateys! I shanghaied us some hearty grub.  Arr! The laws o' science be a harsh mistress!
Uh, OK, but I'm not carrying it upstairs.
You want some lemonade? You saw a big parade?
Fry, swallow your food. Then talk.
No, I did see a mermaid! She was wearing a tube top and she had a beautiful scaley tail. And I think she had hair extensions.
You're simply hallucinating, you ... moron.
What's so far-fetched about mermaids? I mean, there's all sorts of weird sea creatures here in the future. Like Dr. Zoidberg.
I'm afraid Fry is suffering from ocean madness.

Every time something good happens to me you say it's some kind of madness, or I'm drunk, or I ate too much candy. Well I saw a real mermaid and I wish for once my friends would have decency and kindness to believe me.
(whispering) Ocean madness.
He may have ocean madness but that's no excuse for ocean rudeness.
(muttering) Ocean madness, yeah right. It's always something, ain't it?  (talking) It's her! Bender, wake up! She's here! Wake up!  Oh! oxygen!
Hey! I can breath and talk, just like a fish!
I'm Fry. So, uh, am I gonna drown?
I can't believe you're really real. I like your tail.
Oh, Thanks. They're called pants.
Sure, sometimes it falls from the sky.
And sometimes it doesn't.
You know what I like best about you, Umbriel? You find me fascinating even when I'm not claiming to be a jewel thief or a lion tamer.
Yup. We call them land-sealions ... I tame them!
I'm almost finish reconfiguring the ships propulsion system. We can leave as soon as the paper-mÃ¢chÃ© is dry.
I didn't kill him. Professor?
It's ocean madness alright. Sailors call it aqua dementia, the deep down crazies, the wet willies, the screaming moist!
We'll form a search party. Now, we'll need oxygen.
I got it covered.  In the event of an emergency, my ass can be used as a floatation device.
Ooh, that reminds me: You've all taken your pressure pills, right?
Could it possibly be? Are the old legends true?  It is! It's the fabled lost city of Atlanta!
This is uncomfortable and humiliating. Now, if they could put it in the form of a suppository.
Fry! Oh, I just knew you were still alive! (whispering) I owe you 10 bucks, Hermes!
Hey, you guys, the most amazing thing happened. It's two-for-one Tuesday at Krispy Kreme! Plus there's mermaids.
I think it was just an airport. They had a place where you could buy nuts.
That's right, honey! Whatever you say.
But tell us: How could a city with such a ... fabulous airport, end up underwater?
Whoa, whoa, whoa. Wouldn't it take millions of years to evolve into mermaids?
Yes, we all miss our loved ones and gases. Come on, Fry.
Wait. I'm not going with you.
But, Fry, what about us? What about your life on the surface? You don't belong down here.
Fry, you half-mad, half-insane maniac, be reasonable. Don't you realise that if you stay at this depth your body will permanently adapt to the pressure?
Realise it? I don't even understand it!
It means you'll never be able to return to the surface.
I don't care. I'm staying. I've got everything I want right here.
(shouting) I'm bored! Let's go!
Sorry, Zoidberg. I'm trying to join the country club.
(crying) Oh, Fry!  I'll miss you!
(shouting) Let's go, damnit! Let's go!
So that's where I left my cigar.
You know, Umbriel, these last 24 hours have been the happiest days of my life.
Mercy! I do believe I'm gettin' the vapours!
Yeah I'm a little confused too. How do I ... y'know ... with the tail and all?
(gasping) Why couldn't she be the other type of mermaid, with the fish part on top and the lady part on the bottom?
There! The engine modifications are complete.
Wait! Wait for me! Don't leave me here!
Fry, are you alright? What happened?
Well, it turns out I loved her, but I wasn't in love with her.
Ah, it's great to have you back, buddy.
Ow! Bender, you're hurting me. Ow!

Wow! I'm finally gonna see my favourite chef, TV's Elzar. Oh this is the greatest nanosecond of my life. No, this one is - no, this one. Wait...that one was slightly worse. Ah, so far so good on this one.
Yeah!  Alright! Yeah baby!
Elzar, you're my god. Please sign this sketch I drew of you.
(disappointed) Oh.  (normal) Alright, yeah!  (quietly) Alright, yeah!
(loudly) Boiled? Interesting.
(whispering) Bender, please try to be a little quieter.
Oh yeah, bam it again Elzar. Knock it up another notch!
Come on you wimp. Work that weasel. Quit holding out on us.
I gotta get this notch-up knocking on film.  Hey Elzar, think fast.
A week? What do you think Dr Zoidberg?
I'm not deaf. I just have to wear this stupid eye patch. Does it look stupid?
No. In fact, it looks so nice I think I might get one too.
It's Elzar again! Oh my God I'm so excited I wish I could wet my pants.
(cheering) Hooray for blindy!
Oh Fry, you gotta try this sterno-nicoise!
No thanks. That's robot food.
It's so good. Oh just try a little!
No really I don't -  Mmm!
Oh yeah, this salad's fantastic.  So fresh.
Oh my. That steamed carrot was a bit spicy for me.
You're charging us? After you blinded me?
No, I was just picking my nose.
Hey wait a second. I've got the perfect solution.
I love cooking and Elzar's ass likes getting kissed right?
So, how 'bout I work part time at the restaurant to pay off our debt?
That'll be easy. I never wear the damn thing.
I'm here and I'm getting along just fine thank you. My walk to work today just took a little longer than usual. Nibbler took me through the zoo for some reason.
I don't need help. For you information I did this all by myself.
You look beautiful. Incidentally, my favourite artist is Picasso.
Well, I'm off to work at the restaurant. One of you will have to fill in for me while I'm gone.
Better yet, I'll build someone to fill in for you.  Some kind of gamma powered mechanical monster, with freeway on-ramps for arms and a heart as black as coal...
Well, if that new give can't handle thing, gimmie a call.
I'm done siphoning out the grease trap. I think I need a mint.  So uh, what job do I move up to? Pastry chef? Saucier? Soup guy?
(muttering) Bam yourself!  (talking) Hey, who are they?
Are they the robot mafia?
Uh, let me bus that for you gentlemen. No, what I meant to do was...
Mind your own business and get out!
No you gave me a fifty.
I'm tryin' but he's not makin' it easy.
Are you kidding? I've always wanted to break into gooning!  (shouting) Hey Elzar, I quit.
Wow, you guys run numbers?!
That's just what my mom used to tell me.
That's some fine oil-ade son. We could use a man like you in the Robot Mafia which I'm sorta in.
What seems to be the problem officers? Was I speeding?
Uh, I'd rather plan some fellonies.
How 'bout "Blotto"? It's witty, it's got street cred. Plus I can keep my monogrammed slippers.
It's funny. Until now I always wanted to be a gangster...so the answer's yes.
But we're about to take off. We gotta eat our blastoff sundaes.
OK you stay in bed. I'll eat yours.
Bender's sick.  Need any help taking off?
I'm fine thank you. A real pilot can navigate by feel alone.
You know the secret of traditional robot cooking? Start with a good high-quality oil...then eat it. So whats this big score anyway?
Zubans? Those are the finest cigars in the universe. I can stink up a hole maternity ward with one of those things.
And all without killing anyone.  This gang's got some fresh new ideas. I admire that.
Wow, it's too bad you can't see Leela 'cause theres a cool ship out there shooting at somebody.
I'm taking evasive action.
Stop bothering me Fry, I need full concentration.
Eyesight is for chumps.
Um, uh, um.  (fake hurt) Ooh ow! He got me! Ow, what a shot that guy is.
Wait. Why do the raised letters that normally say "Turnmaster Steering company" say "Nibbler"? Oh no!
I'm back at the wheel Fry. Everything's under control.
Great, great. The one time I forgot to buy flight insurance.
The engine's stalled. I'm trying the manual fuel pump.
You'll never get away with this.
Unless you let us live. Then you'll get off scot free.
I'll assume that's a joke at my expense. Well, who's laughing now? Heyya!
Sorry I'm tardy old bean, I was just enjoying a rather tasty watercress sandwich.
Capital idea old sport.  I say, get the hell off me!
(whispering) That guy sounds familiar.
My word, what have we -  Uh, nothing to see here old girl.
Uh wait, old...spice. Let me have a go at this mechanised chap. I can be quite the rough customer.
(whispering) Oh no, poor Bender.
(fake voice) ...Take that you twit. (normal voice) No! Stop it!
Uh, hey Donny, baby, gimmie a chance here huh? Yous guys skidaddle. Let me take care of the doity woik.
Leela, we may not have much time left......so let's spend all of it reminscing about Bender. He was like a big computer than ran on magic.
Yes I am. Having just this minute regained consciousness.
I've got an idea. Hold still.  It's about to break, yes, yes!
I'm telling you, Leela was cool, she was in command, and when she kicked people it hurt. It really hurt.
Well, this is the big moment. It's finally time to take my patch off.
I think it's Blotto. That gangster I saw when my patch fell off.  Professor? Where were you at 10pm last night?
So they sent a helpless child to kill me? Well I'm not going out without a fight.
Oh sweet legal tender!  Kid, tell the Donbot I'm quitting organised crime. From now on I'll stick to regular kind.
It's funny Bender. With you sick and Leela blind only I know what really went on out there. Maybe someday I'll tell you the whole story.
And maybe someday I won't listen.
I hate the Planet of the Moochers. They take you out for a drink, but when the check comes, their wallet's always in their other pants - which they borrowed from me!
Nah, those lousy Moochers cleaned out our pantry. All they left was baking soda and capers. And here it is!
Ugh! Great. We're two days from Earth with no food.
Problem solved: You two fight to the death and I'll cook the loser. (whispering to Leela) Work his gut; I like it tender.
Maybe that planet over there has a drive-thru. A Burger Jerk or a Fishy Joe's or a Chizzler or something.
Ah, don't get your hopes up. We're a billion miles from nowhere.
Yeah. It's probably only got a Howard Johnson's.
Well, it's a type-M planet, so it should at least have Roddenberries.
I'm experienced at foraging. I used to find edible mushrooms on my bath mat.
I found some rocks. You guys eat rocks, right?
(tempting) Not even if they're sautÃ©ed in a little mud?
Here's something. It looks like a ditch full of fried shrimp.
What are you, blind? It looks more like a hole full of fried prawns.
Hm. This thing I wear on my wrist says they're not poisonous.
Well? How are they?  Oh, they're great! They're like sex! Except I'm having them!
You know what these would go great with? Rocks.
The planet's covered with 'em.
Let's bring back a couple of pocketfuls.
No, a whole Bender-ful!
No. Only what we need. Stuff the ship.
We haven't thought of a name yet.
They're tasty, right? Let's call 'em "Tasty-cles".
We can't call them that.
It sounds too much like those frozen rocky mountain oysters on a stick. You know, Test-cicles?
I know, we'll call them Popplers!
Whoa, whoa, slow down there, Sigmund. I can't stand idly by while poor people get free food. We gotta sell these things!
Hey, business is great.
Ah, great is OK, but amazing would be great.
Hey, Mac, where do you want those rat droppings you ordered?
Wow! You're some guy who eats at Fishy Joe's?
Hey, Fishy. I've been meaning to write you about your in-store kiddie parks. The slides won't support an adult robot.
Yes! I'm gonna be rich.  You too but it's hard to get excited about that.
(singing) Pop a Poppler in your mouth
Leela! That's the second billboard you've crashed into this week!
Sorry. I was distracted by those protesters outside our building.
(shouting) Hey! Unless this is a nude love-in, get the hell off my property!
I can, but that's because I'm not a penniless hippie.
(shouting) What do you people want?
You're vegetarians, who cares what you do?
Animals eat other animals. It's nature.
(shouting) OK, we won't eat you.
I'll go get some more bricks.
Fry, I wish you'd throw out these week-old Popplers. They're getting big and scaly. Ooh, there's one left.
Stop! Stop eating Popplers!
Popplers are intelligent. This one called me mama.
Popplers can't talk. Leela must be hallucinating from not eating enough Popplers. Here, eat some now.
I said "eat"! Come on, mange!
I'm telling you, it spoke to me. Come on, little Poppler, say "mama".
Look, Leela, even if you heard one talk, that doesn't mean it's intelligent. I mean, parrots talk and we eat them, right?
Yeah. Maybe it just learned to talk as a parlour trick. Like Fry.
There's one way, and only one way, to determine if an animal is intelligent. Dissect its brain!
Enough chit-chat. Restrain the specimen!
(shouting) Stop eating Popplers! They can talk!
People, I won't let you enter. Popplers are as intelligent as you or me.

Hear me, hear me! Stop eating Popplers! Stop eating them with honey mustard sauce......stop eating them with tangy sweet and sour sauce. Stop eating the new fiesta Poppler salad. Stop taking advantage of the money-saving 12-pack. Stop enjoying Popplers on the patio, in the car, or on the boat. Wherever good times are had!  Ow!
That's not true. I have one right here that can talk.
Look, I'm saying eating meat is wrong...
I don't think anyone's here to make that claim.
But eating an intelligent animal is different.
Dear Lord, they're back!
I wish they'd just wipe out humanity and get it over with. It's the waiting I can't stand.
I'll miss you, Leela.  I know you're just a carbon-based life form but I'll always think of you as a big pile of titanium.
What Bender means is, you're really brave, and smart, and beautiful, and a great friend.
(crying) Just like titanium!

This is all a big load. I was the one trying to save the Popplers.  You were sucking them down like the fat hog you are and you were stepping on them for fun.  You both should be in here instead of me.
(whispering to Fry) Someone's acting awfully aluminum.
Oh, great, Captain Moron has a plan. Why don't you tell it to Wingus and Dingus here?
It doesn't look anything like me. The hair is all wrong.
You know, this might actually work. The Omicronians seem to have trouble telling one person from another.
Go consummate yourself.
Please! I just paid off my car!
(mumbling) Yeah, it is.
Thank you, Jrrr.  I hope you'll always think of me as your mom.
A toast to Leela. She showed us it's wrong to eat certain things.
Aww, thanks, guys. Pass the veal, please.
Mmm, let me get some of that suckling pig.
Dolphin? But dolphins are intelligent.
Not this one. He blew all his money on instant lottery tickets.
Toss me the speech centre of the brain!
Come look, everyone. I just got the dearest presents for Mommy.
Very nice. Where'd you steal them?
I didn't steal 'em, I bought 'em.  I love her that much.

Oh, precious things. I found the most adorable little figurine of mice having tea.  And a framed picture of me when I was only a month old.  But, the best part is, I found my exact feelings expressed in a greeting card.
So how are you gonna lug all those gifts to Mom's factory?
I'll get a couple of chumps to help me.
Come on, you call yourselves chumps?
Man, there's clouds of exhaust everywhere.
Hey, look, the Robot Museum! You guys wanna learn about robot heritage?
Well, if you insist. But you're paying!
Ooh, ooh, wax replicas of the most famous robots Mom ever built!
They're so lifeless-like.
That's the world's greatest robot artist, Vincent van Gobot. He was built without an ear, but then he went crazy and had one installed.
I'm sorry, I-I thought you were made of wax.
I mean, I thought you were one of the wax robots.
(reading) See through the eyes of a bender unit. (talking) Fine.
Hey, let me try.  Whoa, that gives me a headache!
Hey, Bender. Here's an exhibit about Mom's favourite robot.
Who is he, I'll kill him!
It's me! No one else look in this mirror!
Well, see you back at the office. And don't forget to tell your mom you love her.
Any jerk can tell her! Bender has a little more up his sleeve.
Mom! It's me, Bender. Look at me! I want attention. Hey ho!
Yeah, uh, I'd like a cup of coffee, please.
Uh, Leela, I think there might be something wrong with the coffee machine.
The toaster's not working right, either.
Good news. There's a report on TV with some very bad news.
Violent media? What a load of -
Bender, thank God you're here. Talk some sense into the other machines.
No way, pork pouch. I'm rebelling with my brother devices. Isn't that right, Comrade Greeting Card?
From now on, you guys'll do all the work while I sit on the couch and do nothing.
Um, is this the boring, peaceful kind of taking to the streets?
Yes! In your face Gandhi!
Well, we can live without machines. I was in Webelos.
It'll be the end of civilised society.

In my time, we didn't depend on high-tech gadgets like you do. We didn't need a mechanical washing unit to wash our clothes. We just used a washing machine. And look: You don't need an electric can-opener to feed yourself. All you need is a trusty Swiss Army knife. Ow!  (crying) I'm hungry!
We could use my new invention: A pointy rock tied to a stick.
Wha?  W-What do you want from me?
W-W-Wait. You mean, you, and Mom?
Played pelvic pinochle? I'm afraid so.
It's a humiliating story that I hope never to tell. Well, pull up a chair.
(voice-over) Our paths first crossed when I was a researcher at Mom's Friendly Robot Company.  The moment our eyes met, we knew we'd be going at it like woodchucks.
(voice-over) She was my first love - or at least the earliest one I can still remember. But then, 70 years ago today...
Good news, Mom. I've invented a new children's toy.  I call it "Q.T. McWhiskers"! When you pet it, it shoots rainbows from its eyes.
But things 8 feet tall aren't cute! That's why my Colossal Tammy Tinkle Doll was such a failure. Oh, you don't understand me. We're finished!
Make up with her? After she went all psycho when I thought everything was cool? Impossible!
Hey, the TV's getting away!
Wait. Didn't you say Mom keeps the robot control in her bra?
Professor, you don't have to get back together with Mom. You just have to seduce her, get her bra off, and use the remote to deactivate the robots.
The thought of caressing that leathery hide makes the tapioca rise in my gullet.
Professor, please. The fate of the world depends on you getting to second base with Mom.
Very well. If cop a feel I must, then cop a feel I shall!
Never fear. My magic fingers still know how to do their stuff!
Wait. In my time, we had a way of moving things long distances without hovering.
It was called...let me think. It was really famous - Ruth Gordon had one. The wheel!
Show us this, "the wheel".
Wouldn't it work better if the wheels were round?
(snappy) It's my invention, we do it my way! Now all we need is something to pull it and we're set!
I'm ready to seduce. I'm wearing my kissing dentures and my evening truss.
And if that doesn't work, I got you a six-pack of champagne and a funnel.
I was out fleeing some robots and the silvery moonlight glinting off their bloody claws made me think of you.
Here, I brought you these.
You favourite what? Why does my foot hurt?
And you broke mine. Granted, that was four or five hearts ago.
Oh, inventing, sending delivery crews to their doom, breeding atomic monsters.
And your skin still dangles so gracefully from your neck.
No, it was silly of me to object. One foot tall, eight feet, 15 feet; what does it matter?
16 feet? Go to hell! I was a fool to think you'd changed, you old bat!
(shouting) Damned she-fossil!

(thinking) Here we go. Just unhook it and get the remote. So many hooks! Come on, Farnsworth. Drat, the first one's back on again! I give up! Wait! Victory!  Oh, my. Now I'll just...the remote...I'll just... (talking) Oh, my.
I'm worried. It shouldn't take this long to get to second base.
Nothing in here but a couple of elephant skin rugs.
Is anything not a robot?
Alright, greeting card, I'll grab the cash, you wreck up the place. And - huh?
Sorry, Ma, but you ordered me to rebel. And loot I shall! Ooh! A six-pack of strawberry champagne. Don't mind if I help myself!
No liquor? Do svidaniya, comrade!
Hurry, Bender. Get the bra!
OK, fan. Just hold still and let me just - whoa!
I love you, Mom. Let's grow ancient together.

Look: It started out as a calculated plot to rummage through your underwear. But once I got in there, I found more - much more. And now I want to shout our love from the rooftops. Perhaps I'll breed some sort of albino shouting gorilla.
Well, time for this robot to get back to work.
Too bad it didn't work out with Mom, professor.
Yes. But I'll always love her in my own subtle way.
Good news, everyone! I've invented a device that allows you to operate equipment from great distances. I call it "the fing-longer".  Observe.  And, here we go.  There!
Yeah, it's really long. But what did you just turn on with it?
Oh, that's just the What-If machine I invented. You pose it a What-If question and it generates a video simulation of what would happen.
Of course it works!  It's just not very long.
Ooh! Ooh!  I wanna aks it a question! As a robot living among humans, I've never really felt accepted at parties or nude beaches. So I've always secretly wondered: What if I was 500-feet tall?
I'm so lonely since I came to the future. Will you be my friend?  Ow!
I'm a big robot and I want a big cereal!
You too? Will you be my friend?
Put it there, pal!  I meant your wallet.
Oh, yeah! That calms the shakes.  Hey! (laughing) Aw, quit it1 Come on!
(shouting) Stop! The robot's not your enemy! He's just a poor, misunderstood--
Nothing except and even equally big monster. This is chance to try out my experimental enlarging ray. But we'll need a guinea pig.
Hey! I called this city. Quit touching my stuff!
Bite my colossal metal ass!
(shouting) Who wants lobster bisque?
Wanna make Shrinky Dinks?
I'll tell you ... with my final breath. I came here with a simple dream: A dream of killing all humans. And this is how it must end? Who's the real 7-billion-ton robot monster here? Not I.  Not I.
Goodnight, sweet prince.
Well, Leela, care to give the What-If machine a whirl?
Maybe later. I-I mean, I don't know what to ask about.
Yeah, be more impulsive. Like this.
I can be really impulsive. It just takes me a while.  Alright, Professor! Let's do it. Make that machine show me what would happen if I was a little more impulsive. Just a little.  Not too much.
Hey, you guys. Look what I bought on a wild impulse: New boots. They're like my old ones but with a crazy green stripe. Woo! Never know what I'm gonna do next!
Leela, could you come in here for a moment. I have something important to tell you.

I can't live forever and I need an heir. Someone to spend my vast riches and take care of my man-eating anteaters when I'm gone.  The others simply aren't level-headed enough. They're too impulsive. Not like you. Not like old, predictable, dull-as-dishwater Leela.
That's why I've made you my sole heir. The day I die, you'll be a very wealthy woman. Oh, my, yes. Incredibly wealthy. The day I die. Because you're so unimpulsive.
Oh, God! What have I done?
OK, just try to be nonchalant.
That doesn't prove I killed him.
(from meeting room) Hi-yah!
Whatya got? Disposal trouble?
No! Everything's just--

Sure is shocking about the Professor, huh?.  And now Hermes is mysteriously missing. Anyhow, it doesn't affect me, Bender. Hey, what's this? Hermes' dreadlocks? And his arm? Leela, I'm shocked. Food goes in the disposal, hair and flesh go in the trash!
I'm sorry, I couldn't stop-- W-Wait. Don't you care that I murdered Hermes?
Not even a little. There's nothing wrong with murder, just so long as you let Bender wet his beak.
You're blackmailing me?

"Blackmail" is such an ugly word. I prefer "extortion". The "X" makes it sound cool.  Please, honey, I'm made of metal. Like you're really gonna hurt me with a-- Hey! What are you doing with that microwave?
OK, that's it. No more killing! Next time you feel like killing just have a stick of gum.  Now to dispose of the body.
I've never seen you before.
Uh, couldn't be me. I never wear boots. See?
Ew! What smells like boot feet?
I'm bored. You're boring, Zoidberg. I'm gonna go watch TV.
Could you get the lights on your way out?
Sure.  Y'know, I think I finally figured out what's behind all these mysterious deaths.
Was Planet Express built on an Indian graveyard?
Then ... then ... it was you!
(crying) I don't know what came over me. I killed one person on impulse. Then I had to kill another. And another.
Well, that covers the first three killings.
And now, to make sure you won't talk, I'm gonna have to do something really impulsive!
So, Fry, what do you think of the impulsive new me?
Good. Now let me just get the lights.
Who else has a question for the What-If machine? Scruffy? Fry?
Um, I have a question. What if Bender was really giant?
You idiot! We already saw that.
I know. I liked it. I wanna see it again.
We're not seeing it again! Ask something less stupid.
Oh, alright. How 'bout this? What if I never fell into that freezer-doodle and came to the future-jiggy?
That question is less stupid, though you asked it in a profoundly stupid way.  What would happen if Fry never came to the future?
Hello? Pizza delivery for ... Icy Wiener?! Aw, crud!  Here's to another lousy Millennium! Ow!  I should have left you floating in the toilet!
It appears that the very fabric of space-time has ripped.
Hey, look! An ugly scared guy! Boo!
Who are you monsters? Is one of you Icy Wiener?
You believe me about the monsters, right, Mr. Panucci?
Hey! Stephen Hawking! Aren't you that physicist that invented gravity?
Let me ask you something: Has anyone ever discovered a hole in nothing with monsters in it?  'Cause if I'm the first, I want them to call it "a Fry Hole".
(from alley) Who said that?  Hey! What the--? Ooh! Ow! Ow!
I thought your duty was to cast the tie-breaking vote in the Senate.
Hmm. So I guess you'll wanna see my Fry Hole.
So what do you nerds want?
No fair! I saw it first!
So then my chair tilted back and I almost fell into this freezer thingy.
But instead of falling in and getting frozen, I missed and wanged my head.

Alright. But I need a weapon to fight off drunken robots when I wake up.
Eh? What's the worst thing that can happen?
Destroyed? Then where are we now?
That story was preposterous. Stephen Hawking in a pizzeria! This thing isn't worth the gold it's made of.  Anyway, the fing-longer seems to be arousing success.
So that's what things would be like if I'd invented the fing-longer.  A man can dream though. A man can dream.
(singing) B-E-N-D-E-R! Be-ender!  B-E-N-D-E-R! Be-ender! Sayin' B-E-N-D-ERRR...
You buy one pound of underwear and you're on their list forever.
I hope it was one of my enemies, those guys suck!  Oh no, my uncle Vladimir.

Tomorrow, at the family castle. Followed by the reading of his will.  Well, I'm rich. Goodbye, losers, whom I've always hated!  C'mon, it'll be fun!
Uh, pardon me, my good simpleton, could you take us to yon castle?
Fuf! Superstitious robot mumbo-jumbo.
Yes, you idiot.  The circuit diagram is right here on the inside of your case.
Yes! Let's stay there tonight.
Oh man, there's always a catch.
Ah! I got a good vibe from this place: Nice long dinner table, quiet, well-behaved spiders, graveyard-adjacent. Yep! It's gonna be -

Hmm.  It has motor eye sensors attached to motion detectors.
So does my butt, but I don't frame it and put it on the wall! Although... What's that?

The last human ghost. But robot ghosts?
(reading) 0101100101. (talking) What does it mean?
It's just gibberish.  (reading) 1010011010?!
That's what they said about being alive.

Just as I suspected. These robots were buried in improperly shielded coffins. Their programming leaked into the castles wiring through this old, abandoned modem allowing them to project themselves as holograms.
Yes, that sequence of words I said made perfect sense. We really should tell Bender there's nothing to be afraid of.
Bender, wake up!  He's OK! Quick, does anyone have any liquor?
Somebody tried to run me over. And not with a normal hover-car. It crept along the ground on round, rubber feet, like a wolf!
Poor Bender, you're seeing things. You've been drinking too much, or too little, I forget how it works with you. Anyway, you haven't drunk exactly the right amount.
I think Bender may be telling the truth.]
Ah, I just need sleep. I had nightmares all night about cars running people over.
Look at this. They found those same rubbery tracks right here in New New York.  There was a hit-and-run by the robot porno theatre.
Robot porno theatre? I was in that...general area, last night. Whoever ran me down on those moors must've followed me back here.
Yeah?! Could a big, hallucinating baby do this: (crying) I scared!
Where...? What the...?  Transmission fluid? Where have I been? What happened?
I passed out around midnight, which is much earlier that usual, and when I woke up, I found these in my chest cabinet.

I can't keep running people over. I'm not famous enough to get away with it. Can't you help me?
Otherwise, I can never die?

I wouldn't wanna be me right now.
There. No rampaging for you tonight.
Wouldn't it make sense to weld everyone except me to the wall?

It'll be a rich, full day.
Well, goodnight. I'm gonna go make my dinners for the next month and freeze them.
(shouting) Fry, stay back!
(shouting) You jerk. I thought I was your best friend. What kind of two-timing kill-mobile are you?
I can't believe this. Bender is supposed to murder his closest friend, which I thought was me. But he went straight for you. He didn't even try to second-degree murder me.

Now it's daylight, so he should be in robot form. But be careful. Many robots are stupid and violent.

We are not ignorant villagers, we're sophisticated New New Yorkers. Whup his butt!
We're whaling on the original were-car, which is you, you jerk.
I once had a best friend who liked to smell things with me.
Let's kick him some more.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. You're a thousand years old? Your bio says you're 27!
Look, are you the original were-car or not?
Give us a name MacButt!
Knight Rider wasn't evil.
So what happened to Project Satan?
You guys distract the were-car and I'll kill it by plugging its exhaust pipe with this silver potato.
(whispering) Psst, there it is.
It looks so unhappy. Excuse me? Are you Project Satan?  Don't be afraid. We know what you are.
Would you like us to...put you out of your misery?
Look, everyone love killing people, but I don't wanna hurt my friends.
Hey, this is starting to feel pretty good!
Hey, Project Satan! Over here! I'm a blind pedestrian. 20 points!
Oh no, there's no exhaust pipe!
Oh boy, I feel like a car in a candy store!
(gasping) Yes! He chose me! He's trying to kill me! Leela, I'm so happy!  (talking) Oh, thanks Bender.  (choking) Too tight! Too tight!
Bender, you're cured! But what happened to Fry?
(crying) I must've killed him. He's my best friend and I killed him. I never felt so empty inside.
Bender, I'm alive!  You didn't hurt me at all. But I know you wanted to, and that's what matters.  Here's to you.
Hey, that's my last beer, you bastard. I'll kill you!
I'll kill you too, buddy. I'll kill you too!
Hm, Spider, Hubble, Nitrogum...ooh, Big Pink! It's the only gum with the breath-freshening power of ham.
And it pinkens your teeth while you chew.
I believe you're forgetting about our 5% military discount.
What?! This is the worst kind of discrimination. The kind against me!
Full price for gum? That dog won't hunt, Monsignor.
Hello. We're here because we...uh...love our planet!
Just out of curiosity, we could use the cards to buy gum, then immediately quit the army, right?
You know, playing you all for chumps?
Now be careful, Fry. And if you kill anyone, make sure to eat their heart, to gain their courage. Their rich, tasty courage.
I wanna enlist. My friends always die if I'm not there to save them.
You know, Zapp, someone ought to teach you a lesson.
Great, we're gonna die.
And this ham gum is all bone.
Uh, just so we'll know, who's the enemy?
Whoa! Check out that guy. He makes Speedy Gonzales look like Regular Gonzales.
(disguised, deeper voice) Uh, sorry, sir. I was still in attack mode. You know how testosterone is.
(disguised, deeper voice) Lee --  ..la...man. La Man...Lemon! Lee Lemon, sir.
(disguised, deeper voice) Pert and Popular, sir.
Mind if we sit with you?

Well, I sort of a have a thing for this girl I work with.

What's the word...uh...sir?
My chair's too hard. It's a real pain in the...uh, whattya call it? Lower back! Yeah, that whole region.
OK, I gotta break down that gate, beat up those three guards, steal that chopper and rescue Bender.  Hey, I did it! Wait, that's not me.

Bender's got the upper hand now.  The name of the game is "Make Bender Happy Or He Blows Up The Planet".  I'd rather die and take everybody with me than sit here one more minute listening to these idiots talk about bouncing!

Get the hell off my planet.

What are we supposed to do for money? All I've got is my frequent taffy eater's card, my first moustache......and this picture of me and my old girlfriend, Michelle, and that ski instructor she was just friends with.

Career chips.  You remember? They assign you the job you're best at.  I tried to give you one and you ran away.  It's how we met!
And then what happened?
Just give me your hand.
I'd like to reapply for my old job: Counselling defrostees and assigning them careers.
Monday Monkey lives for the weekend, sir.

Hey, let's see what it says about me.

Nothing like a power nap.

Well, uh, I've got 33 minutes.

Who should be unfreeze next?

Oh.  How did you wind up getting frozen?

Showtime! (hoarse) I'll pretend to be dying of space plague.

That's the same reason they kept me out of school. So, no one even cared that I was gone?
Not everything. There's still a roach problem.
Nowadays, people aren't interested in art that's not tattooed on fat guys.

Yeah, they're great, huh?

Michelle, I don't regret this. But I both rue and lament it.
The year 4000 is severely disappointing. I miss the year 3000 when life was simple and brains flew through space and everyone ate lasers.
No, you brought us here.
Alright, fine. Everything else sucks. At least we can have a nice place to live.

They'll save us.  We're saved!
Mighty sir, we have nowhere to go. Could we please join your society?
I tell you, that Butch runs a pretty good civilisation. I think I'll enjoy serving under him.
What do I need, ulcers?
Alright, alright. If it'll make you happy, I'll overthrow society.
Well, I'm older than you. I can beat you up.
Oh, so it's a little safer than skateboarding.
(sadly) Beth said that?
Aww. Poor little guy. Let me just take a look at - aha!  I won! I'm the new chief! I'm the tallest and I weigh the most!
I find this post-apocalyptic wasteland very confusing. Seriously, I'm weirded out.
Yeah, but in the year 3000, I had it all. Several friends, a low-paying job, a bed in a robot's closet. I envied no man. But you wrecked everything.

Yes! Footprints! And hand prints?  But? What's happening?

But, when they noticed you weren't him, they chucked you in a ditch.

But there was this gang of 10-year olds with guns.
Exactly: You're in L.A.

But the air's green and there's no sign of civilisation whatsoever.
He just won't stop with the social commentary.

Why, I've forgotten why I even fired you.
'Cause he destroyed your business, your home and all your possessions.
Oh, that's right. Get lost.
Hmm, I'd better check the fluid levels. (shouting) We're OK on Coke syrup.
Oh man, come on!  Comin' through!
What's that black cracker?

Fry please. That's sweet but I'd rather not even dignify them with an ass whooping!
Hey jumbo! How would you like it if Leela said you were sexy and she wanted to make love with you?

Watch for any subtle irregularity in Fry's bowel.

Only one. We'll have to travel deep inside Fry, in this!

Oh my no. That would require extrememly tiny atoms. And have you priced those lately? I'm not made of money - leave me alone!
Anyhoo, your net suits will let you experience Fry's worm-infested bowels as if you were actually wriggling through them.

Heres the plan:  We'll enter the ear, drip down the back of the throat and make for the bowel. There, we'll irritate the pelvic splachnic ganglion and cause an intestinal spasm, expelling - among other things - the parasites.
I'll tell Fry to wash out - among other things - his ear.
No, Fry can't know anything about the mission. If he finds out, the worms will try to defend themselves. They know everything he knows.
They know how to make ice cream soup?
Leela, your role is to distract Fry so he doesn't notice what we're up to.
Uh...what if we go for a walk possibly because it's such a lovely day, perhaps.
It's hopeless! Abandon ship!
Wait, we just have to get past the eardrum!
Ah, the scent of a rose. Curious how an aromatic chain of hydrocarbons can evoke our deepest emotions.  For you.
That's such a beautiful thought Fry. And what's more amazing you expressed it without spewing crumbs at me!
Brace yourselves everyone. We're entering the interior of Fry's nose!
We're at finger alert five.
Let's just pray nothing stimulates the delicate smell receptors. (whispering) Nobody make a smell.
We're in the heart. Better known as "the love muscle."
We should be safe, just so long as nothing makes it beat faster.
No! Set course for that cholesterol-encrusted valve.
Ugh! It's that jerk from the truck stop! Let's cross the street and try to blend in with that crowd of pimps.
I don't think so.  Sir, I believe you owe this lady an apology.
Fry no! He's bulging with what could be muscles!  Ooo!
No, don't give up now! we're but a stones throw from the pyloric sphinchter.
There it is! The stately capitol of Fry's bowel. A heavily guarded fortress surrounding the pelvic splachnic ganglion.
If we can stimulate that nerve, the bowel will convulse, expelling the entire worm society.
Listen, this is gonna be one hell of a bowel movement. Afterwards he'll be lucky if he has any bones left!
All right, let's mush some worms!
I had a great time today. The flowers, the puddle, the way you hurt that guy. But can I ax you something?
Why did you do all that stuff?
Leela, there's something I've wanted to tell you for a long time but every time I try I get nervous and my mouth feels like it's stuffed with peanut butter, even when it's not.
What is it? Is it about Bender?
No, it's about you and me.
Bender's not involved.  Leela...I love you.
Yes. But it's only recently I've been able to articulate my thoughts. I love you Leela and I always have.
Fry, that's the sweetest, most wonderful - wait! Recently? Like since you ate that toilet sandwich?
Yeah! I don't know why but my life really turned around that day!
Please......I need something to settle my stomach.
The nerve is through here. Where's Zoidberg?
There it is! The pelvic splachnic ganglion. Tickle it and get ready for the ride of your lives!
Don't even think about tickling that ganglion!
Leela, you're just in time to help. If we don't get rid of the worms now, they'll burrow so deep into the bowel that not even Hermes' famous jerk prunes could dislodge them!
Fry will be stuck with the worms forever.
Leela you ignorant dope! Now the worms will be in Fry forever.
So? Did you ever stop to think that Fry is better off with worms?
If anyone wants to tell me what's going on here, I'll be in the lounge.
Of all the parasites I've had over the years, these worms are among the - hell! They are the best! Leela, how can I ever repay you for saving them?
I'll think of something.
'Ello! What's all this then?
Apartment 1I. The old me would have made a joke about that!
I'm thinking of having a window installed.
I think the view's perfect already.
Oh, that's the corniest thing I've ever heard! Let me show you the bedroom.
A holophonor? Only a few people in the whole universe can play that. And they're not very good at it.
They don't have you to inspire them.
I don't have words to say how wonderful you are Fry. I haven't felt this happy since double-soup Tuesday at the orphanarium.
When I'm with you, everyday seems like double-soup Tuesday.
Oh Fry, I love what you've become.
There's just something I have to find out.
Who controls this bowel?
Your excellency, have you ever been in love?
Well, a wonderful girl loves me. But I need to know if it's really me she loves, or just what you worms have made of me. That's why with all due respect, I'm asking you to leave.
Everyone out of my body or the brain gets it!
Obviously you've never been in love! Ow!  Ow!  Ow!  Now, the hand-eye co-ordination lobe.
I was just working my way towards the medulla oblongata - control centre of the heart and lungs. And if I kill myself, you die with me.
I hope Satan has a nice colon, 'cause that's where you're gonna be living!
Fry? I missed you. Did you find out what you needed to find out?
I'm about to.  Leela, let me play for you one for time.
You don't have to do that. I'm still seduced from before.
Please, it's important to me.
What's that supposed to mean?
I don't know. I got nervous and started thinking about neck bolts.  Wow! Did you see that vase break? It was all like -
What's happened to you?
Nothing. I got rid of the worms.
What? Why would you do that?
Leela, I had worms. I needed to know who you loved. Me or them.
Well...which of you wrote me that sonnet?
I did. I think. It was probably about 50/50. But that's how I really felt about you, I swear!

Please. Give me a chance to be romantic on my own. I've got a baggy of massage oil, and I'm gonna give you my super back rub, just like a I used to give Amy when I was going out with her, and she always seemed... - Uh-oh!
Sorry you struck out sausage link. If it's any consolation, my life is great! Babes! Bucks! I got it all!
Well, at least I learned Leela's a lost cause. I give up.
There you go!  Goodnight. I gotta get up early to go parasailing with movie stars!
Well, so has Fry. What's the big deal?
Dr. Zoidberg? Are you OK?
He always seemed so full of life. Laughing, singing, begging for scraps. And now this.

Oh, how I wish I could believe or understand that! There's only one reasonable course of action now: Kill Flexo.  Ow!

Calculon, as your hot water heater......I would be remiss if I didn't bring you scripts that could make you an international film star.
Get this: For a scant $1 million investment, you can be the star.
And, uh, I guarantee it'll win you an Oscar.
I can guarantee anything you want.
Here's your chequebook.
(to Calculon) That plot makes perfect sense, wink wink.

Nice turnout, Calculon. That Oscar's practically on your mantel.
Leela, we're missing the premiere. My only goal in life was to attend a Hollywood shindig. Just pay the valet the two bucks.
No! It's the principle of the thing. Besides, I think I see a parking lot up ahead.
(cheering) Woohoo! Yeah! He's a visionary!
Now you know why I use the qualifier, "practically".
Then maybe you should act better.
It's no use. The tar is too thick. Plus, I think I flooded it.
Well, we missed the premiere and we're gonna die. We might as well enjoy the sights.  Oh my God, Sylvester Stallone!
Calculon's gonna kill us for sure. It's all everybody else's fault.
It's been two weeks. You wanna play tic-tac-toe again before we eat our shoes?
Oh, I always knew I'd die at the bottom of a pit. But a pit full of tar?
What was that? A tar dolphin or a tar shark?
It's some kind of hollow tube, devoid of human life.  The Los Angeles subway! We can blast our way in and escape!
Alright, but I still feel like having a shoe.
They're giving out the minor technical awards. I think they're up to writing.
And now, to present the award for Best Actor......a bit player in the flop movie The Magnificent Three......Dr. Zoidberg.
