And Bender, that aerosol head spray makes your head smell nice...
...but it's doing long-term damage to the planet.
So? It's not like it's the only one we've got!
Good news everyone! I'm sending you on an extremely controversial mission!
For this highly controversial mission, you'll be towing the Juan Valdez, an orbitting supertanker full of rich Columbian dark matter.
Dark matter oil? What if we hit something? The tanker could leak!
Impossible!  The tanker has 6000 hulls. So, unlike me, it's entirely leak-proof! Now, once you've hauled the tanker past the protestors -
Why do we have to fly within three feet of this penguin preserve on Pluto?
(whispering) To avoid the tollbooth.
Alright, she's all restocked with emergency jam. Let's get going.
At the risk of sounding negative: No! Look Professor, I can't participate in this mission.
What are you yapping about?
This time it's your reckless disregard for the environment. In fact, I'm gonna go join those protestors.
This is an outrage. I demand that you hand over your captain's jacket.
This is my normal jacket. I've had it for 10 years.
I said hand it over!  Well Fry, or should I say Captain Fry?  No I shouldn't. Because Bender is the new captain!
That's right. Being a captain is about intuition and heart. A good captain can't have either one. That's why cold, logical Bender is perfect for the job.
Well, I do think of human life as expendable.
No fair. Leela was training me to be captain. She even let me sit in her lap and steer - in this comic I drew.
Fry, the title of captain may inflate the human ego, but it's beneath the notice of my mighty robo-logic!  Now look spry men! We launch at six bells!
Why do we have to resort to non-violence? Can't we just kick their asses?
Aye! We're hitched up tighter than Davy Jones' U-Haul! At ease men!
Mr Fry. I like to give my first mate an informal nickname. From now on, you will be known as...Wiggles!
I have now. And what's Peter Parrot's first rule of captaining?
Correct Wiggles. You've just earned an invitation to the captain's table.
When you were planning this peace ring, didn't you realise spaceships can move in three dimensions?
Aww they're so cute! They're like if puppies and kittens could have babies!
...But I suppose it's this medal I'm most proud of Wiggles. I won it for saving the children of Earth from a giant kangaroo. It was on the Australian news, you probably didn't see it.
Would you cram a sock in it Bender? Those aren't even medals! They're bottlecaps and pepperoni slices.
Thank you steward. Wiggles? Weren't you about to propose a toast to your gallant captain?
Fine, I've got a toast. To Captain Bender! He's the best......at being a big jerk and his big ugly face is as dumb as a butt.
If I were in charge I wouldn't treat you like this. You're nothing but a big blowhard.
Sir, you forget yourself! Shut up!
Being captain is obviously more important to you than being my friend. I'm going.
Going? But, a captain can't drink without his first mate!
I don't feel like drinking.
(soberly singing) Oh Greenland is a barren land, a land that bears no green. Where there's ice and snow and the whale fishies blow and the -
Gah! I once knew a guy...you look like him. But he wasn't either.  I'm a good captain.
Bender's flying too low! And he's upside-down!
Oh the fools! If only they'd built it with 6001 hulls! When will they learn?
I don't think any of those poor, oil-drenched penguins feel.
Five hours? Aw man! Couldn't you have just gotten me the death penalty?
Yeah, uh, good luck with that.
Now you stay away from those puffin twins.
Uh...I think I'll go check on Bender.
Ah, can't beat fresh squeezed!
Bender, can you at least pretend you're being punished?  And clean the black parts too.
Yo, screws, more Tegrin over here? Oh ho, what's this?
Has anyone seen Bender? (shouting) Bender? Here robot robot robot.
Hey, why weren't you Kong donkeys outside cleaning up?
You ate most of them. So, where's Captain Bender? Off catastrophising some other planet?
I'm worried about him. He didn't come back with the group.
No. And with windchill it's 20 degrees below absolute zero. I'd better go find him.
Wait. Let me. Bender and I have our disagreements, but we're still friends and I'm gonna show him what that means. To the ship.
Why don't you just walk? He was only about 20 yards from here.
Madam, I am in command now.
What the?  What's this water made of? Ice? Forget this!
(in penguin) Not entirely.
Then where are we? You said you knew how to navigate.
Oh if only we hadn't flown penguins to Pluto and dumped oil on them, this might never have happened. Can't we stop them from multiplying?
What is it? We'll do anything.
You can't shoot penguins. Isn't there some way to prevent them from breeding?
Well...I suppose...but...I mean...I joined Penguins Unlimited to love penguins, not to hunt them.
(crying) Oh God it's inhuman! It's like Hong Kong! I'll do it!
Hey, you're enjoying this.
I'm sorry but if it's fun in any way it's not environmentalism.

Alright, this is for their own good. Don't leave orphans. Gotta kill entire families.  But they're so cute. No! You can do this. It's just like murdering a little butler. I...I can't look. (crying) Oh no! What have I done?  Oh you poor little guy! I'm so sorry I - Bender?  What's going on? Were you hiding out with these little guys?
Of course not. Filthy ice rats. Scat! Shoo!  Gah! What are you doing? Get away!
Well I don't love them.  Aww!  I don't know why but when I look down at their little faces, it makes me wanna puke! In a good way!
(in penguin) That's Puffin talk. Now follow me!
Stop! Stop shooting! It's me, Leela.
Look, I don't know if shooting penguins will help the environment or not. But I do know that the decision shouldn't be in the hands of people who just wanna kill for fun.
(in penguin) We will fight them on the beaches! We will fight them on the glaciers!
They used to be such peaceful birds. I suppose this was your doing.
Yep. It's like I taught 'em. If it ain't black and white - peck scratch and bite! Now to take off my tuxedo.  Guys, it's me! Your lovable dictator! Uh-oh!
Oh, if only we had a toboggan.
Oh phew!  Oh right they can swim. It's all coming back to me now.
Well, at least it'll help reduce their population.
Yeah, life is hilariously cruel.  Permission to come aboard Wiggles?
Granted. We can't take off without our captain.
Oh, and bring my toboggan.
So Leela, were you able to help the penguins?
Well sure. I mean...not really...I mean...nature will work itself out. It can't screw things up any worse than we did trying to fix things right?
Ah, quit your worrying. Thanks to my shining influence those stupid birds'll do just fine.
No fair! You changed the outcome by measuring it.
I'll tell you when my horse finishes...bad.
Ooo look! It's the centaur race!
Come on, come on! Hey Leela, how 'bout a kiss for good luck?  I meant tongue luck.
I am so unlucky! I've run over black cats that were luckier than me.
I'll have a cholesterol free omelette with horse beaters.

Dear Horse God, I know I don't usually pray to you, sometimes I doubt you even exist. But if you're willing to grant me luck, please, stamp your hoof once. Come on number six move it!  Don't do that! What are you -  Man it's contagious!
That'll teach those other horses to take drugs!

That's it! You can only take my money for so long before you take it all, and I say enough.  I've got one dollar left, and this one I'm holding onto! Oh no you don't!  I may not know much about horses but I know a lot about doing anything for one dollar!  If you think bad luck can defeat me then you don't know my name is Philip J -
Kareem's got the skyhook but Philip J. Fry's got the spacehook!
Hey. That's my patented spacehook! You stole it!
Holy camolie! A seven leaf clover!
Phil wins! Yancy's fans are stunned! There'll be no celebration at the Yancy dome!
Well someone's in a good mode.
Let's just say I lucked out at the track! Also I rigged one race.
Pah. I'd have won a lot of money too if I still had my lucky seven leaf clover. Plus I'd still have my hair.
I hid it in a secret hiding place who's location I never told anyone. Not even Scruffy.
Hey yeah! Maybe it is still there! Underground in the ruins of Old New York. Helping some ant defeat another ant or helping some piece of dirt turn it's luck around.
Dirt doesn't need luck.
I'm going down there to get my clover back. Now some of the tunnels have metal bars so I'll need someone who's good at bending. Leela how 'bout you?
Like hell you will. Bending's my middle name.
Yep. My full name is Bender Bending Rodriguez
Here's the entrance.  From this moment on I declare my bad luck officially over.
Well if we get bored I've got Tetris on this thing.
Old New York. The city that inspired a casino in Las Vegas.
Wow! We've got Manhattan all to ourselves! I can finally do all the crazy stuff I always dreamed of doing!  Howard Stern s overrated!  Uh, oops!
And remember when Mayor Giuliani cracked down on jaywalking?
Well Rudy, how'd you like this action?
The moonwalk...the robot...the zero
The robot? That's similar to mine!
What are you doing? You totally ripped off my routine.
Why do you always have to steal everything from me Yancy? Find your own life and live it.
Well I'd like to see you try and steal this. the septuple head spin.

Alright team, let's go find that clover!
Which way to your house? The sign says we're at 71st street.
71st street? Hmm, never heard of it. Downtown could be in any direction.
No sweat, we'll just take a spin on the B-train!
Ooo that feels funny!  This is the Brooklyn bound B-train making local stops at wherever the hell I feel like. Watch for the closing doors.
Wake up buddy end of the line!

Gosh my old neighbourhood!  That's the bench where I found some shirts!  That fire hydrant! In summer we'd light it on fire! On that corner, some guy with a bushy beard handed out a socialist newsletter!
You'd better believe it!
The old comedians were right, this place is a lot different from LA!
Yeah, he was my neighbour. Why?
Get out of here! What's Andy up to these days?

Man, father time really took a bat to this place.

Not yet commander. Yancy's just trying to steal my stuff as usual.

The Ronco Record Vault! Yancy'll never get his hands on you in here or my money back.  Ah The Breakfast Club soundtrack! Man I can't wait til I'm old enough to feel ways about stuff!  Stay safe clover. I may need you again someday.
This was the storage room. My dad spent years turning it into a bomb shelter.

Hey who's been messing with the radio? This isn't alternative rock. It's college rock!
Oh it must have been the ship's new improved personality software I installed.
Listen ship! No one changes my stations! I hope you have a good mechanic!
It even comes with an adjustable voice.
Wha? Did you just say...?
Too late baby, you said it! So what'll it be? My place? Or you?
Before we deliver these hearts, I'm gonna find the one that sums up my feelings for you!  "I Love You." Hmm, too conventional. "You're My Man." Ooo so close!
I'm not impressed by a guy's message Fry. I'm impressed by the guy. Or not.
Maybe we hit a space cow.
You know you love it sugar-engine!
Bender!  What's going on in here?  Planet Express Ship! Cover your shame!

Wow Bender. Are you and the ship an item? I mean I know you're both items but...how can you date a ship anyway? It'd be like me dating a really fat lady. And living inside her. And she'd be all like...
Fry, in order for me to get busy at maximum efficiency, I need a girl with a big 400 ton booty!
Bender, dating your co-worker and primary mode of transportation is immoral, illogical and a violation of interstellar shipping statute 437-B.
That's what makes it so nasty!
Still, given the chance, I've given to urges far more shocking.

Daisy, Daisy, give me your answer do. I'm half crazy all for the love of you.  It won't be a stylish marriage......I can't afford a carriage.  But you'll look sweet upon the seat of a bicycle built for two.
The ship? But you just started dating.
With my mighty robot powers I can get sick of things much quicker than you humans.
Well just remember we all still have to work together. So try and let her down easy.
In due time Leela. But for now I'll just resume dating cheap floozies on the side.
You have much to teach us.
Ugh. Doesn't it bother you even a little to be taking advantage of your girlfriend's trust?
Oh wait you're serious. Let me laugh even harder.
Well baby, for starters you gotta be honest all the time!
Planet Express Ship? Is that you?
Uh, um no. I think he's at his parent's.
Bender? No! He's an old fashioned one spaceship robot. Look I'll tell him you stopped by OK?
Eh, they're all pretty unimpressive.
Yup. Mind numbingly interesting. Ooh!
OK, I like a challenge.  Aah! I got it! I'm going to be completely honest with you Planet Express ship. Those women you saw me with...were my accountants!
No one baby! Lucy Liu is the only girl for Bender!
Planet Express Ship is something wrong?
Uh look, I'm not saying Bender's not great but have you ever considered that maybe he's...y'know...not that great?
Could you maybe pay a little more attention to these asteroids?
Esteemed potentates of Omicron Persei 8, please accept these 20 billion candy hearts as proof that Earth loves you. Thiiis much!
Incoming torpedoes. Shields at maximum yarnell.
Steady, Planet Express Ship. Focus on diverting all power to the scramjets.
Uh look, Planet Express Ship, this might not be the best time...but...well...I really like you and whatever but...I think we should just be friends.
Well, it was a spectacular battle but there doesn't seem to be any permanent damage.
Aww, calm down. I'm sure Bender is taking this just as hard as you are.
Bender is great oh Bender is great. Bender Bender Bender!
You couldn't have picked a better time to dump the ship Bender!
Eh, the moment seemed right. Call me old fashioned but I like a dump to be as memorable as it is devastating.
I know, I know. Look Ship, if there's one thing I learnt from my mutual breakup with Sean that was totally mutual its that happiness can only come from within you.
Trust me. You can't change men anymore than you can change the laws of time and space.
Uh sweetie? You see that giant quasar we're heading into? You might wanna scooch a few parsecs to the left.
What's happening? Space cow?
The ship's just taking the breakup a little hard. (whispering to Fry) She's nuts!
Uh you don't need to kill us Planet Express ship...because...I love you! Uh yeah baby! I feel like doing stuff.
Whoa whoa whoa! Slow down! All of my friends that have done that said that afterwards all the passion went out of their relationship.
Look, I don't know if you want my opinion -
Now look missy! If you don't trun around now I'm going to have to shut down your brain!
Ha! That barely hurt Leela at all!
This is the one place she can't hear us. Everyone just pretend to shower.
Same as everyday, got it.
Comprendez Bender? You'll have to distract her. Merge your program with hers while I shut down her brain.
It's too risky. I'm a very meek individual. If her personality engulfs mine, the Bender you know and worship could disappear forever!
I'm willing to take that risk.
Hey pookums! Contrary to what I was saying earlier, melding minds with you would be extremely bearable.
Huh? Tubes? You're older than you said you were!
I prefer two. That way we can still be a horse for Hallowe'en.
OK, Bender has her distracted. Now I can shut down her brain by deactivating the carbonated logic matrix.  Ugh. I can't concentrate with this obnoxious candy in my face.
I'm on it. And maybe I'll find those magic words while I'm at it.
Eh.  Blech!  Eurgh! Ooo how 'bout this one?
Give it up Fry! I've got to pop these tops in a precise order.
Halfway there. The ship should be getting a little less rational now.
Only a few more.  Hey! I won free admission to Six Flags! Just one more reason we must survive this.
Fry! I'll read your candy later! When we're not dead!  What was that?

Last one!  It worked! Gravity normal, air returning, terror replaced by cautious optimism! We did it Fry!  Fry?  You gave me your oxygen? Oh no! Breathe Fry breathe!  You leave me breathless! Happy Valentine's Day Fry!
Aw. What crazy thing am I going to date next?
Well at least it sounds like you were able to keep your conciousness seperate from hers.
Of course! Bender is a lone wolf. A solitary eagle.  A cuddly baby Tapir! And that's why I love 'em!
Well I guess we'd better clean up these millions of hearts.
Nah, I've got a lazier idea.
Good news, everyone! You all know the orphanarium where Leela grew up?
Sure. We talk about it all the time.
Well done, fellows! Anyway, said orphanarium has named Leela orphan of the year.
And the good news keeps on coming. Behold my latest invention.
Ta-da! It's a glow-in-the-dark nose you can wear over your regular non-glowing nose. Observe.
Now I can punch you in the nose in the dark.
(snuffed) Where'd it go?
That? It's uh...nothing. Yes, nothing. If you think it's anything you're a suspicous moron.
What does it taste like?
Alright, alright so the machine produces a few toxic by-products! You don't have to make a federal case out of it.
500 real dollars? That's an outrage! Professor, I'll take care of that waste for $499 and 100 cents.
Hmm, I know that's a rip but I'll pay for the convenience. Do you take credit cards?
Alright, environment, you've met your match!
Honey, that thing was ruined the minute it went on you. That's what I'm talkin' 'bout.
Thank you very much. Like many of you I never knew my parents...
...I don't know if they were mighty alien overlords or simply underpaid alien janitors who fought crime on the side --
(shouting) It's crooked!

...In the end though, it doesn't matter who my parents were. All that matters is what I learned here, within these unscalable walls, that I have strength to make it on my own, just like all of you kids here today.
Yes! I mean no! Just make sure you get my nonchalant side!
If those aren't tears of happiness, please stop crying.
(crying) It's OK, Fry, I'm fine. I won an award today.
Is it this room that's making you sad? It's probably the room. Come on, lets go for a walk.
I'm sorry you saw that, Fry. I usually try to keep my sadness pent up inside where it can fester quietly as a mental illness.
Yeah, I do that with my stupidness.
I told a whole crowd today that being an orphan made me strong. But all I really wanted was a mom and dad, to hold me and stroke my hair and tell me they loved me.
Then today's your lucky day because I happen to be a holding, stroking, lovin' machine! Also spankin'!
That's not even close to what I had in mind.
Well, anyway, just remember that people care about you.
I know.  Sometimes when I'm lonely, I look up at the sky and I get this feeling that somewhere, on some unknown planet, circling a distant star, my parents are up there, looking down on me.
Yo yo, Bezender! What up?
My dumping business is booming. I just got hired to clean up the set of Free Willy 3.
Bender! Cut it out! First of all the sewer mutants will be mad. Second, everything else that's horribly wrong with what you're doing!
Ah, those stupid mutants can't do anything. You seem to be forgetting one simple fact, namely, I'm up here and they are safely down --
(shouting) What did I do to deserve this?
It's like that time I peeked in the kitchen at Imperial Hunan.
Wait. I don't even have DNA. Why am I screaming?
Who said that? How do you know my real name?
I don't know. I think I saved us somehow.
It looks like...a timeline of my whole life.
That's when we saved Earth from a giant asteroid of garbage.
And here's when I dropped out and bummed around India for a while.
And this is just last year at Space Mardi Gras.
Its like some kind of weird Leela museum...and I'm the Leela!
(whispering) Dude! Over here!
It's all the best stuff I ever flushed down the toilet! Those are some of my diary pages. And my screenplay!
And also - for some reason - the letter I wrote you full of my personal feelings.
Oh, I'm scared!  My whole life has just been a show for some perverted mutant!
Leela, freak out later. We're not done escaping yet!
(sarcastic) Oh cruel fate! Can we really never return to this dank pit of sewage?!
Wait a minute. Why aren't you gonna kill us anymore?
Yeah! What are you chicken? Buk buk buk bukuk!
(whispering) Shut up, you two! We can kill ourselves when we get home!
Uh, I'm gettin' dizzy! I can't walk straight!
Come on Leela. You can do it!
Hurry! We're missing our bus!
Whoa! What are you doing?
I'm gettin' on the bus!
(shouting) Don't worry! I'll be fine! (talking) They know something about me and I've got to find out what.  The lake didn't mutate me. What is going on here?!
Eurgh!  Who the hell are you?
Leela's going nuts and I can't save her unless I learn more about her mysterious past. Isn't there anything else you can tell me?
That's impossible because my time is worthless!
Look, I'm trying to save someone here. I'll have to come back for those later.
Of course. But only into Beta Crypt 3, a language so complex, there's even less chance of understanding it.
I didn't ask for a completely reasonable excuse. I asked you to get busy.
Isn't that the same machine that makes noses?

It can do other things. Why shouldn't it?  Of course, even if it is possible to analyse the message there's no way of knowing how long it would take. It could take an hour or it could take a hundred million years.
Certainly not. Two dings means it's done.  But not like that. Slightly more rapid.
Good news, Leela. I landed the contract to empty all the spitoons in Little Italy.
That's it, it's done!  I can't believe it! My mind is boggling. The analysis of the note is printing out now.
Hands up!  Tentacles too!
What is all this?  Am I a game to you? Or some kind of even more boring Truman Show? Do you belive I'm you Messiah? Your Mutant Dali Lama? Stop me if I guess it!

(angry) And what about this?!  How did you get this bracelet? Did you steal it from me when I was a baby? Or from my parents. You robbed my parents, didn't you? I bet you sick mutants killed them. My parents were confused aliens lost on Earth and you killed them! Is that it? Admit it!
Because of you I'll never know my parents. I'll kill you!
Stop!  Thanks Bender! Don't do it Leela!
They killed my parents!
I had the Professor analyse the alienese letter that was found with you.
I 'unno. But the analysis showed it was printed on recycled toilet paper. A squeezably soft paper used mainly in the sewers.
So, I'm not an alien? I'm a mutant.
(crying) You're my parents. All I've ever wanted is to know you.  This is the happiest moment of my life.
Thanks so much for inviting us, Mr. Wong. I've never been to a Mars Day barbecue.
This is quite a large ranch you have.
It's the same on Earth.
Yeah, yeah, get on down!  Oh, yeah! Drop another barnyard bomb on us, Vanilla Corn!
So what's Mars Day about, anyway?
How can you call the Native Martians "stupid"?
I can't believe you're laughing at the tragic exploitation of a proud, bead-loving people.
Lighten up, Leela. It's funny!
Of course it is. But you don't have to laugh!
I'll have a thorax and some feelers.
What's that weird sound?
Hmm. I might have mental anguish.
What happened to the buggalo?
It sounds dangerous. Someone could get killed. Fry, Leela, Bender, I want you to go with him.
We've got a right to pick a little fight with rustlers,
Wow, look at that: Olympus Mons. The tallest volcano in the solar system.
And even thought the computer was off and unplugged, an image stayed on the screen. It was ... the Windows logo!
Pfft, that's not scary!
It is if you're a laser printer.
OK, my turn to tell a ghost story. Once, there was this woman driving--
Fine, Mr. Know-It-All-About-Something-Finally, you tell a story!
With pleasure. (spookily) Once, not far from here, four people set out on a cattle drive--
(speaking fast) Robot gets bored and kills Fry with a hammer! (normal) Sorry, go on.
And then, while they sat helplessly around the campfire ... a demented knife-wielding escaped lunatic libertarian zombie mutant snuck up and--
Not unless your parents have thousands of helicopters at their disposal.
Too late! This is more fun!
Hey, it's that "barbecue's over" sound again.
(shouting) Sandstorm!  We're in the eye of the storm!
Also, I didn't know buggalo could fly.
Don't worry, Kif. I'm sure some other beautiful, rich girl will fall in love with you.
This mission is incredibly dangerous. Someone's sure to be killed. Fry, Leela, Bender--
Aw, look. Betsy followed you, Kif!
What about the Great Stone Ass of Mars?
They have such respect for the planet.
Uh, actually you traded it for a bead.
Ow, ow, ow, ow! My eye!
Wait. That's the bead you traded your land for?
It's a gigantic diamond! That thing must be worth a fortune.
Oh, Chief, you've made me the happiest girl in the world!
So we can have the diamond?
But what about your sacred land?
Ooo! This is it! Turn me up!
More like three lockers and a sink!
Bender? Did you have something to do with this?
Yeah make me famous big head!
Hey! Now what am I supposed to watch and drink all day?
This is an outrage. What's the point of pulling the biggest pool caper ever, if nobody knows you did it?
Well there's the material rewards.
(crying) All I ever wanted was for people to remember my name... (hoarse) it's Bender.
Oh fuff! What's the point in remembering something? You're just going to forget it five seconds later.
(crying) It's so unfair. A debonair robot with a zesty in-your-face outlook doomed to obscurity like the rest of you especially Leela! If I died tomorrow, no one would even notice.
How does a nobody like me get famous? I know!  Hey look! I'm stuck! But I haven't given up hope! Call a soft news journalist!
Hey everyone do The Bender! This move's called The Bender!
A blank wall! Fame is mine!
There, now no one will forget how I lived or my attitude regarding butt.
I'm the first one to work. A new low.
A surprise funeral? For me?
We just wanted to show you that you really will be remembered.
Ooo! Cushiony! And a minibar!
Dearly beloved, we are here today to remember Bender, taken from us in the prime of life, when he was crushed by a runaway semi, driven by the Incredible Hulk.
Aww, you knew my favourite cause of death!
Now let us each remember the best things about Bender in our own way. Professor?
Your standard Bending Unit is made of an iron-osmium alloy. But Bender was different. Bender has a point-04% nickel impurity.
(crying) It's what made me me.
Eh, the Professor's was better.
Bender shush. You're supposed to be dead.
Say more about how great I am. And where's the crying? You people look like you're waiting for the bus.
Danny-boy? You're at my funeral, singing about some dead stiff named Danny-boy? You really are a massive bonehead.
Get lost. I'd say "Don't quit your day job!" but you're awful at that too.
Your best is an idiot. Let's pick it up people. So far it's been crap after crap! I croaked now show me some love!
Come on, surely there must be someone here who knows how great I was.
Yes there is Bender. Bender was a lot of things to a lot of people, but looking back, the number one thing I can say about him is this, and simply this: Bender was my friend.
What? That's it? Who are you? You're nobody! This is the worst funeral ever! I hope you're all happy. You've succeeded in convincing me life is worth living - by showing how bad my funeral will suck.
News everyone! Today you're going to Osiris 4 to deliver this enourmous sandstone block.
I thought something looked different in here.
Hi, we have a giant stone to deliver - sign here.
Impressive, who's building it?
Call it a hunch but, I've got a bad feeling about this.
You know the worst thing about being a slave? They make you work but they don't pay you or let you go.
That's the only thing about being a slave!
Incredible. This place is just like the Ancient Egypt of my day.
I knew it! Insane theories: one! Regular theories: a billion!
Look at these swanky tombs! These people really know how to die!
Are you crazy? They worked thousands of people to death to make these stupid monuments.
Hey, you spend you're whole life building a guy's toe and you're gonna remember him!  I think I'm gonna like it here!
Pick it up people, we're enslaved here to do a job. Master? Do we have to count to three every time? Couldn't we just count to one. Or better yet one half?
Come on guy's, Pharaoh's countin' on us. Work faster, like this.  You call that motivating me? Don't just whip with your arms. The power comes from your hips. Like this.
Bender, quit giving the slave drivers pointers!
Yeah, remember who your real friends are.
I'll tell you who I remember.  Enupsis! Pleeltut! Whatsisname! He was the greatest of all.
Hurry! Hurry! Pharaoh's coming! Get that nose in place, come on!
Woohoo! Viva Hermenthotip!
Go faster? I told them but they're so damn lazy.
Freeloading off you? I agree.
(crying) He's whippin' angels now.
(crying) I'll always remember you Hermenthotip!
Can you believe it? Pharaoh's dead!
Yeah! Play those bongos!
I'm gonna spin til I fall down!
We interrupt this prophecy to bring you late breaking bulletin. He hammers the back of his head and creates and imprint of himself on the wall.
You know what else stinks about being a slave? The hours.
Those are waves jackass, it's supposed to be a river!
Hey, I think I know who the next Pharaoh is!
Behold! I have emerged from the place of spells and fairies!
This society is a bunch of idiots.
Citizens of Me! The cruelty of the old Pharaoh is a thing of the past.  Let a whole new wave of cruelty wash over this lazy land.
Hear the word of Pharaoh. Build unto me a statue of ridiculous proportion. One billion cubits in height......that I might be remembered for all eternity. And be quick about it!
Lowly slave. Why are you not working?
I meant yourself to death.
Well then what do you think you should stop doing?  Crawl pigs!
The Pharaoh has spoken.
Your task is nearly completed. Don't let down Pharaoh now.
Hmm...its a good start. Uh...yeah it's definately big alright. I just wonder if it's too big y'know? I mean, are people gonna be remembering me or the statue?
Too exact if you ask me. Tear it down and start again. But this time don't embarrass yourselves.
What about my servants?
Bender, I really hope that's you. 'Cause if it isn't......we're in trouble!
You jerk. Why'd you have to drag us along?
I wanted to watch you remember me.
Did you really think you'd need all this junk in the afterlife?
Afterlife? Pfft. If I thought I had to go through a whole other life I'd kill myself right now!
Well rot in peace. Fry and I are leaving.
Sorry but we're totally sealed in. Nothing can get in or out. Except millions of snakes.  Here, have a pomergranate scnapps from my private distillery and start sharing fond memories of me, Bender.
What proof is this? Some huge number?
It's explosive! Maybe we could escape by setting fire to the distillery and blowing this whole place to rubble! Let's get a little kindling going!
No! You can't blow up my monument, I won't be remembered.
Oh right, how selfish of me. We'll just stay here forever. Hey Fry, remember that robot "Bender"?
Bend-er? Doesn't ring a bell.  Did you hear something Leela?
No. But I bet it wasn't someone who was good at stealing.
Stop it stop it! It's not right! You've crossed a line!
Hey Leela you know who I remember...?
Oh please, let it be me!
...That guy who used to bend things. You know...?
Alright alright! If it means that much to you, blow up my statue!
Oh Bender! When did you come in? Hold still!  Let's blow this tomb!
(crying) I will. I will.  Please, just leave me alone.
Bender, I understand your desire to be remembered. But you don't need a statue for that.
No. You have your legacy as a brutal tyrannical dictator. And that will outlive any monument.
You really think they'll remember me?
Well in that case. One planet down! Helmsman...
...set course for Earth!
You know, pirates - but in space.
(shouting) Hey! Keep it down you kids! I'm trying to take a nap!
(muttering) ...make Bender take a nap in a tube.  (sexfully) Come back when I've had some sleep baby!
Fry to battlestations. Fire torpedo number three.
Firing torpedo number three!
That's not torpedo three. That's not torpedo three at all.
Damn you Fry and Lee......la!
(shouting) Help! Mechanical man overboard!
It's no use. We were going full speed when we fired him so he's going even faster than that.
You mean we can never catch up to him? Not even if we rub the engine with cheetah blood?
I don't know how to say this Fry. But Bender is doomed to drift through space...forever.
(solemn) He always wanted to drift forever. But through the American Southwest.

I'm going too fast. I've gotta lose momentum.  Ohh. I'm gonna spend eternity alone with barely any swag.  Ooo! Hey universe! Check out the dude with the rolex!  Wow! Ostentatious!  Except what good is a candelabra without - wait I know!  Ah the pity. Fated to drift forever through the void as gravity's plaything. Oh cruel fate, to be thusly boned. Ask not for whom the bone bones. It bones for thee. The only thing that keeps me sane is the thought that I have all eternity in which to perfect my art.  Ohh!  Damn you!

There. Now when I'm found in a million years people will know what the score was.  Hey what's bombarding me?  Oh no! An asteroid field. If even a pea sized asteroid were to whiz through my skull it could -  Ow! Hurt slightly! Well that was fun. Now for eons of loneliness.
Worshippers? This ought to liven up my endless tragic voyage.
Hmm, those peewees think I'm God huh? Hard to blame 'em!  I am the Metal Lord. Who are you?
Listen here Malachi. Time for a religious donation. Hand over your wallet.
Eck! Gag unto me with a spoon! Malachi, it's high time I laid down a few commandments. You got a chisel? Take this down.  Number one -
(shouting) Make it a double!
Can you find him Professor?
No. I'm afraid the smelloscope isn't powerful enough. Bender's odour is so mild it's being overpowered by local sources.
Well, I guess that sounds OK.
Ooo! Microbrewed! My guys did alright! I think I'll make my countenance to shine down upon them!  Malachi, good work. There's no slowing down with the Metal Lord tonight.
Wait a second. Did you rip off your own arm as a joke?
Aw, it's all my fault. Malachi, tell thy people that the Lord is moved by their plight.
This looks like a job for God!  What the? Malachi, what manner of deal is this with the chanting?
Very well. What do they want?
Um, that was a practice miracle. Who's next?
Very well. Let there be light.
I got it I got it!  Um, when you're writing the Bible, you might want to omit that last miracle.
He decided not to let go.  I can't believe you're gone. I won't! If I can't reach you physically, I'll just have to try something desperately crazy!
So that's my story Father Changstein el Gamahl. Is there anything religion can do to help me find my friend?
Uh-huh but is there anything useful we can do?
Bonder? Is it really you?
Wait a minute. Bender's name isn't Bonder, it's Bender. You're a fraud!
Only if you don't have any real hope.
I've not heard of them.
You think they'd let me use it to look for Bender?
(irrate) Yes Malachi what is it this time?
Of course they're unheeded how am I supposed to hear prayers coming out of my ass?
Malachi, every time I interfere I only make things worse. You're best off solving your own problems.
What part of "nay" doesn't thou understand?
Sir, I'm outfitting an expedition to a monestary high in the Himalayas. I'll need a long sleeved coat.
Look, I miss Bender almost half as much as you do but you can't bring him back this way. It's hopeless.
You can't give up hope just because it's hopeless. You gotta hope even more and cover your ears and go "blah blah blah blah blah blah blah!"  (shouting) I'd also like a pack mule.
Well, you obviously won't listen to reason, so I guess I'll listen to idioticness and come with you. But we'll need a Sherpa to guide us.

Now that's one Bible that doesn't disappoint on every page! Looks like my society's running pretty well without my meddling - huh?  Atomic bombs? Oh no! Those unbelievers from my backside must have found my nuclear pile!
You're with me now. This is the maximum level of being with me!
(crying) No!  (laughing) Ooo it tickles!
Hello? Is anyone still alive? How about in the porno theatre?  Don't be embarrassed. (crying) They're dead. All dead. Who would have known playing God could have such terrible consequences?
(shouting) Fry, if I drop dead from exhaustion make sure my body freezes in a dignified position. None of that huddled over for warmth crap.
Looks rickety. We'd better test it.
Hey, that galaxy's signalling in binary! I gotta signal back! But I only know enough binary to as where the bathroom is. (shouting) You speak English?
What are you some kind of galactic computer?
Oh my God. Are you God?
But why would God think in binary? Unless...you're not God, but the remains of a computerised space probe that collided with God.
How long have you been at it?
Sort of like a giant kareoke machine?
Hmm, finding God, that - that's important, yeah. But you know what might be a treat for everyone? If you let me use the telescope to find my lost friend Bender.
Aw c'mon, you guys have forever to look for God. All I'm asking is one measley lifetime to find my friend.
That telescope is as much mine as it is anybody's. I'm using it whether you give me permission or not.
Heyya! You're order may be famous for it's martial arts. But I've never met a holy man I couldn't clobber.
Oh. Then get in the laundry room or I'll kick your butts!
So, do you know what I'm gonna do before I do it?
What if I do something different?
Cool cool! I bet a lot of people pray to you huh?
Y'know, I was God once.
It was awful. I tried helping them. I tried not helping them but in the end I couldn't do them any good. Do you think what I did was wrong?
Yeah I know, that's why I asked if what I did - forget it.
Or a guy who burns down the bar for the insurance money.
Does that mean you wouldn't send me back to Earth even if I prayed to you?
Hello? Has anyone out there seen Bender?
Fry, it's been three days. And even if you stay here the rest of your life, there is virtually no chance of finding him. It's time to give up.
(sadly) You're right. I'm never gonna see him again. I know he was evil and on more than one occasion he, he actually stole my blood.  But still, I wish I had Bender back.
Huh? Wha? You say something?
Bender! It's a miracle!  Ow!
This is by a wide margin the least likely thing that has ever happened.
Guys, you'll never believe what happened. First I was God then I met God!
We climbed a mountain and locked up some monks.
Oh no the monks. We forgot to let them out of the laundry room.
Do we have to? I mean they're monks. I'm sure their God will let them out or at least give them more shoes to eat.
Fat chance. You can't count on God for jack. He pretty much told me so himself. Now come on. If we don't save those monks no one will!

Oh God! I'm dead. Well, no matter. (reading) Thank you all for coming. I don't recognise any of you, nor can I recall why I am here. Now without further ado, a film highlighting Planet Express Inc.'s latest fiscal year.
Ooo, a bot-mitzvah. Shalom hunger, shalom free food!
So what's the deal? You guys don't believe in Robot Jesus?
This toads the wet sprocket. What about our thousands of shares of stock?
'Cause your apartment smells like Polygrip and cat pee.
This is perfect for me.
Boneitis? Pft! That's a funny name for a horrible disease.
Y'know that dance wasn't as safe as they said it was.
They're scared of our raw power. Oh but if you want a job, I could beg everyone at the company where I work.
Aw come on! I got a lot of ransom notes to send!
I move that your cat stinks and is ugly.
I vote my 10,000 shares for the Professor.
I nominate That Guy. Not just because he has a suit but because he knows about business and stuff and he has a tie. My shares still count if they went through the washing machine right?
40,000? How come you have four times as much stock as the rest of us?
I'll ruin you like I ruined this company.
Uh, um, uh business plan, uh, yes. I keep it here - right next to my heart.
I'm rollin' up the corporate ramp.
No thanks I make my own.
No we're not. And as vice chairman, I believe I speak for the entire board when I issue this challenge to Mom. Look at my butt!
Woo yeah! Hit him hit him hit him! Now this is the high life! Watching apes mangle each other near celebrities!
Uh, work really really hard?
This company's on the fast track to the It List! Blast back kudos all around!
Uh hello? We haven't made one delivery since you two took over.
That was terrible! People won't even know what we do.
I don't even know what we do. Nah just kidding, what are like a bus or something?
Did you approve that awful ad Fry?
Yes I did Leels! And I'll tell you why. Because it grows the brand.
Make it two. And a glass of all your water.
Don't you worry about "blank" let me worry about "blank."
What a pleasant surprise!
I'm on it. But if you need me you know where I'll be.
Fry we're worried about Planet Express.
Don't you worry about Planet Express. Let me worry about blank!
What? I haven't changed.  Suz? Have I changed?
I don't care what Ms Johnson says, Thst Guy's turning this place into some kind of...business.
This isn't a business, I've always thought of it as more of a source of cheap labour. Like a family.
You're right Professor. We might not be a traditional family like the Murphy's next door or the lesbian coven across the street but we are a family, and That Guy understands that.
Uh Ms Johnson? Please bring in some more chair fuel.
I had no idea the company would be sold. I was just an innocent suck up. You've gotta believe me!
Just leave us alone and let us clear out our lockers.
Ms Johnson, you've never lied to me. Am I still a good person?
I've got to redeem myself. Somehow, sometime, for some reason. I'll block this takeover!
Believe it or not, I have more important things to do today than laugh and clap my hands.  Reschedule.
I'll vote it down like a raise for school teachers!
Zoidberg owned 51% of the company?
Ow! And also it hurt my feelings!
They are? Oh my God! I'm a millionaire! Suddenly I have an opinion about that capital gains tax!
As vice chairman of Planet Express I'd like to say a few words. There comes a time for every man who becomes rich and deserts his friends, when he goes back how it was. For me, that time is now....
...So I ask you, as a friend, won't you stop this deal?
Oh my God! His boneitis!
I don't think so. 'Cause as vice chairman of the company I gain voting control of his shares.

I'll be whatever I wanna do! That Guy was the greatest businessman that ever lived and before his mysterious death he taught me everything he knew.  But some things I had to learn myself. I learned that money is fine but in the end what counts is people... ...People you love... ...You can't put a price on that... So I'm giving up control of the company... ...to a man of enourmous experience... ...Professor... ...Hubert Farnsworth.
Oh uh what? I'm awake, I'm awake!
Fry, stop doing the right thing you jerk!
Let Mom buy the company! We all wanna be filthy stinking rich!
You mean you'd rather be rich than work together?
In my whole life this company was the only place I ever really felt at home. If being millionaires is more important to you than our...
...friendship, then I'll sell Planet Express, for you.
It is? Yahoo! We're poor no matter what I do! The deal is off!
Look, so we're not millionaires. At least we all still get to work together!
Oh put down the binoculars Fry. The wall of that strip club isn't going to collapse twice in one day.

I know, and I've grown to accept that. Now I'm more interested in that new pizza parlour across the street. Kinda makes me pine for my days as a pizza delivery boy. "Here's you pizza," I'd say. "I didn't order any," they'd say. And then I'd be off to my next adventure.
That story stunk. Hand me the binoculars. I think the owner is from Cygnus 5.
Cygnoids? On our block? Flying foo! They should go back where they came from.
Professor please. Society's never gonna make any progress until we all learn to pretend to like each other. Now lets go over there and make these hideous strangers feel welcome.
Uh, hmm, do you have any food?
I don't mean to offend but this tastes like vomit.
No, actually I did mean to offend a little. This is awful.
Hey hey, what's wrong? Was it something Leela said?
Aww, don't cry foreign people. I used to work in a pizzeria and as soon as I stop hallucinating and blasting puke, I'm gonna teach you to sell pizza - Earth style!
For starters, only use quality ingredients. Case in point: No more live bees.  Oregano works equally well. And when you put pizzas in the oven, don't get in with them.
Most important of all is the big screen TV. Human families need a TV when they're eating so they don't have to talk to each other.  Ah, the Earthican pasttime, blernsball!
Well if you're going to be Earthicans we'll have to teach you. How about your pizzeria plays a game against Planet Express? Oh but you'll need nine players.
(shouting) Go team! Beat those no good Cygnoids! Show them they stink at a game they've never played before!
(shouting) Sorry about that, I guess I needed a few more warm-up pitches.
No batter! No batter!  No batter anymore.
(shouting) I didn't mean to hit you, I have some trouble with depth perception.
Hey batter batter batter! Hey batter batter batter! Hey batter batter!  Duck!
Leela, you beaned a run-in. You'd better let me pitch.
But I've got a no-hitter going.  You're right. Here.
Wait I know you. You're the sleabag who owns the Ultimate Robot Fighting League.
The Mets? Those bums are worse than me.
You mean I'd be the first woman ever to play major league blernsball?
Wow, the first woman ever to play major league blernsball.
Ta-da! The first woman ever to play major league blernsball. How do I look?
Why is your number seven-eight's?
All the whole numbers have been retired.
Wow, I must say I'm impressed. You look just like a ball player. Can I pat you on the butt?
Fry I'm a professional athlete! So go ahead.
Ohh, now I'm too nervous.
(shouting) Come on girl!
Bender, how did you get in here?
Since when are you my agent?
Quiet, call coming in.  Yeees...? A big endorsement deal for Leela? How much...? Hey! You put a one and two zeroes in front of that or we pass...! Deal!
Bender that's great! How much did you get me?
(impressed) One hundred dollars.
(reading) As a pitcher, I serve up plenty of bean-balls, so I know good beans when I see them. Bean-Bay Beans - they're the beaniest!
You're the best babe!  Hang on call comin' in.  What's that...? Hey you put a one and two zeroes in front of that or we pass...! Deal!
So what did you get me?
(impressed) A thousand and one pesos!
Yo soy muy malo en lanzar, pero yo soy muy bueno en comer frijoles. Come los Bean Bay frijoles, los frijoles de los reyes.
Aww, sure thing sweetie. Who should I make it out to?
That's a popular name today. Little "e" big "B"?
Five bucks an autograph, 200 fans. Add a one and two zeros in front of that and we got ourselves a wad!
I'm not doing this for the wad. I'm doing it for all the struggling female athletes who need a role model.
Oh, following in my footsteps?
Alright shows over no refunds, you heard the robot get out!
I'm a fool. The fans haven't been cheering for me, they've been cheering at me.
(crying) That's what makes it so sad. I thought I was doing something heroic.
You are. What about that little girl you visited in the hospital? You know the one I mean? The one who died?
You're right. I can't let people down anymore. As God as my witness, I vow to earn the respect of girls and women everywhere. I will become the best blernsball player of all time.
Oh. Then I have a new vow. I solemnly swear that I will become not the worst blernsball player of all time.
Hey look! The player's who broke the various colour barriers!
When will Man learn that all races are equally inferior to robots?
Ah, here we are - the worst player in history. If I can be just a little better than him I can slink away with my head held high.
It says he once struck out when his tongue got stuck to an unusually cold bat.
And here he is trying to make a catch with an oven mit.
It's even a crummy hologram.
Hank Aaron XXIV? How could you play so blowfully? The original Hank Aaron was great!
So Hank - the bad Hank, just how blowful were you?
Leela could beat that. She's pitched her whole career without getting an out.
Look, I don't wanna be in this exhibit. That's why I need your help - so I can be one tiny iota less pathetic than you.
One thing she can do is lodge a ball in the depth centre of your brain. You better get a batting helmet.
(quietly) Alright, low and away!
You mean "keep your eye on the ball"?
(whispering) Psst, you're holding the bat upside down.
I didn't hit the batter! For once I was pitching and not just belly-itching!
Hey! You opened a franchise!
Come on skipper, it's my last chance to prove I'm not the worst player ever. Please put me in.
I've been training with Hank Aaron.
I've been training with a Hank Aaron.
(shouting) Put it right down the pike!
(shouting) Strike him out Leela! Do it for the hundreds of women everywhere!
(quietly) Keep cool, she's just like any other player. She puts on her sports bra one arm at a time.
Strike one - a personal best!
Jackie. I guess you were right, I'm a lousy role model. I'm sorry.
Oh, that's so kind of you. I guess I made a difference afterall!
Hey, uh, what's with all the pots and pans? You building a wife?
Part of one. Meantime I'm cooking up a tasty Sunday brunch for my best friends!
Brunch. Right. I'd better warn - tell - warntell the others!
Yes, it's a perfect scale model of the universe's largest bottle. I put a tiny spaceship inside to keep it from being boring.
Get -!  For the last time Zoidberg look with your eyes not with your claws!
Brace yourselves. Bender is making us brunch.
He's so proud of his awful cooking. If we don't eat it he'll be crushed.
Alright don't panic. If we can get to the ship, we can fly north and hide under the polar icecaps for a few weeks.
Uh, with you blocking the only escape route? Don't be silly!
In that case brunch is served! Let's go, move it out, stop crying Leela!
Zoidberg, are you coming?
Because I don't want you touching that thing.
Today, I've personalised each of your meals. For example, Amy, you're cute, so I baked you a pony.  Come on! Eat! I slaved all day over a filthy stove!
Good thing I secretly installed this wormhole in the table!
You know I'm not quite sure.  Oh dear me!
The pie is ready. You guys like swarms of things right?
How interesting Dr Zoidberg. Do go on.
Hey check out the palm tree! It only gets sick when I cook brunch! How's that for a coincidence Professor? With all your precious science!
Man, I don't wanna hurt Bender's feelings...
...but this food actually tastes better as vomit!
It's unbearable! How much do you think it would cost to get my tongue removed?
(crying) And this time I mean it!
Aw, who am I kidding? It was stupid of me to ever dream of becoming a chef. I don't have what it takes and nothing can change that.  Then it's settled! Elzar will teach me to cook!
But I watch your show. You owe me!
What was the first one again?
I thought that was number two.
(singing) I'm walking on sunshine! La la la la sunshine!
(crying) It's over! My dream of being a chef is deadder than the cat I'm sitting on!
Oh OK I thought you said "romo."
I've seen bigger. Oh wait I'm thinking of Eugene Oregon.  Wait. A pie with hobo-lifting aroma? Who baked it?
Yo Spargle, if you're such a great cook, how'd you end up in this dump?
My story's a lot like yours only more interesting 'cause it involves robots. That jerk Elzar ruined my dream of being a chef too.
It's so unfair! I have eight other senses but I'd trade them all, even smission, to be able to taste.
Or like how Rembrandt was blind and had wooden hands!
That's right Ricardo, a ship in a bottle...! What's that...? Well hang on, I'll look.
I've gathered you all here in the accusing parlour because one of you is a miniature ship wrecker!
Certain clues suggest the culprit is none other than our own...Philip J. Fry!
Oh it was a brilliant scheme but you made one fatal mistake...leaving this confession note.
Well, I don't remember any of that but I don't have the wherewithal to defend myself.
Then I have no choice but to charge you the full cost of the materials. $10.
Yahoo! Another thing I'm great at! Wait. Why'd you stop eating master?
What? My dinner killed you? Oh man!
A diamond vial of Mrs Dash?
I'll avenge you master. I swear, in the presence of these drunken bums, that I shall defeat Elzar!
Elzar, I'm a walking pile of your unfinished business!
Helmut Spargle has a message for you. He says (hoarse) "Ooo, I'm dead!"
No. He was eating some food I made and by a crazy coincidence his stomach exploded. Now I'm here to avenge him.
Maybe so but you are his sworn enemy. I challenge you to a battle of the chefs.
Iron Cook eh? I can't lose. I'm 30% iron!  You're going down! Uh, also I had a reservation for one, under "Dr Bender."
(shouting) Yeah you show 'em!
(quietly) If it's chicken: chicken Ã  la king. If it's fish: fish Ã  la king. If it's turkey: fish Ã  la king!
Yo, hook me up. My turkey is dry and I've tried everything.  Oh right. Never mind.
Master Spargle. If you can hear me up there in that ditch where I left you, this is for you.
That's my robot! I own him!
You honour me chairman Koji.
Chairman-san, I came here with one goal. To humiliate Elzar in a large stadium. I believe I'e done that.

But the true Zen of flavour is not found in a coliseum. It is found in a small kitchen, with friends. That is why I decline the title of Iron Cook and accept only the lesser title of Zinc Saucier which I just made up. Also it comes with double prize money.
And that's how I defeated Elzar - thanks to Spargle's magic liquid.
Yes, we were there. And we just finished watching it on TV.
Hmm. Let me see that vial Bender.  Good Lord! According to the spectrolizer, Spargle's magic ingredient was...water. Ordinary water!
Ah, so the real gift Spargle gave you was confidence. The confidence to be your best.
Yes, ordinary water. Laced with nothing more than a few spoonfuls of LSD.
The important thing is, by my standards, I won fair and square. Now, who wants brunch? Cooked with plenty of..."confidence"?
Wait! He plead not guilty.
The Professor said he was taking a brief nap, so we only have time for six movies.
Lets take these six Jim Carrey movies and record over them.
You know what movies average out to be really good? The first six Star Trek movies!
(whispering) Sh! Those words are forbidden!
That sound! It's patrol car 718! Hide him!
Another classic science-fiction show cancelled before its time.
She's all yours, buddy!
I'd only met the defendant, Fry, once, but I knew he was up to no good.
Mr. Nimoy, I came as soon as I heard what happened centuries ago. I can't believe your show was banned.
You know? 1966? 79 episodes, about 30 good ones.
Come on! Remember that episode where you go high on spores and smacked Kirk around?
Aha! You can't escape it!
Uh, jeez, don't get upset. I mean, OK I outwitted you, but--
I'm literally angry with rage! Your co-stars may be gone but we can still get those episode tapes back for the whole world to see. Come on!
You can't go to Omega 3; It's forbidden! I forbid you!
But we have to! The world needs Star Trek to give people hope for the future.
But it's set 800 years in the past!
Yeah, why is this so important to you?

'Cause it-it taught me so much. Like how you should accept people, whether they be black, white, Klingon or even female. But most importantly, when I didn't have any friends, it made me feel like maybe I did.
Well, that is touchingly pathetic. I guess I can't let you go alone.
I'll go too, with Leonard's permission, of course.
We're entering the Omega system.
Forbidden shmer-shmidden! What are they gonna do, write a letter? (sarcastic) Ooh, I'm so scared!
I've lost control of the ship!
It's all stuff from that forbidden show.
I can't believe it! How'd you all end up here?
Now say "nuclear wessels"!
But who's doing all this for you?
Whoa! What a cheesy effect!
Alright, you gas, what's the deal?
Tremble? I laugh. Nobody knows more about Star Trek than me!
Cool! A Star Trek convention!
Uh, can people who hate Star Trek leave?
For one hundred quatloos: Who did the captain maroon on Ceti Alpha V?
You have my fan script?
(smug) Oh, I was confused because the scoreboard says something different.
Uh, you probably don't want us to see you rehearsing, or it'll give away the ending.
We'll go wait in the ship.
Not 'til I get my 600 quatloos!
This is wrong. We shouldn't have abandoned them there.
I dunno, I'm feeling pretty good about it.
I didn't wanna leave them either, Fry, but what are we supposed to do?
Well, usually on the show someone would come up with a complicated plan then explain it with a simple analogy.
Hmm. If we can re-route engine power through the primary weapons and reconfigure them to Melllvar's frequency, that should overload his electro-quantum structure.
Like putting too much air in a balloon!
Of course! It's so simple!
(shouting) OK! I'm done re-kafoobling the energy motron ... or, whatever.
Its not working! He's drawing straight from our weapons.
Like a balloon and ... something bad happens.
So, uh, how's rehearsal going?
Where'd you get an idiotic idea like that?
Great list. Except, you forgot episode 66!
Can we get on with this? My foot's getting tired!
There, we can make these into spears.
And we can tie these caterpillars together to make bow strings for bows and arrows.
And we can use this machine gun to shoot them! Yee-haw!  That was fun!
Well, here goes nothing.
Then do it the wrong way.
Is that all you've got? Hi-yah!
All this time we thought he was a powerful super-being, yet he was just a child.
Alright, Koenig, I've wanted to do this for years!
Bender, wait! This is our chance to escape, before Melllvar comes back. But we all need to work together.
We've decided to work together.
We can't use our ship; We have life support but the engines are wrecked.
Hey, if your engines work--
Stop! You're just goin' around in circles! (to himself) Think, Fry, think! Everyone's depending on you.
We're too heavy. You guys need to lose some weight, fast!
Look, Leonard, we're light enough to keep the tapes! Isn't that great?
Melllvar's got a spaceship!
The Nimbus! We're saved!
You started this stupid court martial. Now if you don't mind, we're still fighting Melllvar!
One more hit and we're done for!
Thanks a lot, Takei, now everybody knows!
Wait! If they mean that much to you, why do you wanna kill them?
Melllvar, you can't let a TV show be your whole life. You can do anything you want. Look at Walter Koenig: After Star Trek, he became an actor.
Whoa, whoa! One step at a time.
Episode 10, Balance Of Terror.
And all you had to put up with was one really annoying Star Trek fan.
Man it's hot! (different voice.) How hot is it? (normal voice.) It's so hot I poured McDonalds Coffee in my lap to cool off.  Jonny Carson said it.
No! Nibbler, don't drink the pool water! It's full of chlorine!
Lightweights! Oh wait - chlorine!
Perhaps this movie will help us take our minds off the heat.
Well, we just need one of those big ice cubes. Someone should call the losers who are supposed to deliver it.  Hello?
You heard the good news everyone! Save the Earth, et cetera et cetera!  Bye!
Wait! Where do we get the ice?
The wha? Oh Halley's Comet of course. The only sufficient source of ice cubes that don't have bugs in them!
Wow! Mining a comet, that sounds fun!
Yes there's no safer occupation than mining. Especially when you're on a snowball whipping through space at a million miles an hour!  Safe!
Wow! That ice dispenser's so big, the ice crushes you!  Yakov Smirnov said it!
Oh my God! It's out of ice! Like some outer space Motel 6!
This could mean the end of the bana daquiri as we know it...also life.
Bender? Are you crying?
Well everybody, I just saved a turtle, what have you done with your lives?
Bender a turtle isn't yourself. Why do you care about it?
Because I also care deeply of things that remind me of myself. Like poor little Shelly here.
For one thing, we both have a tough outer shell.  But lead a rich, inner life. Also...well you know...
You're both alcoholic, whore-mongering, chain smoking gamblers?
No! Its just...neither of us can get up when we get knocked on our back.
What? I've seen you get up off your back tons of times.
Those times I was slightly on my side.
Uh, that's not necessary, really! I think I hear my factory recalling me.
Oh! That's what I get for sharing my vulnerability with you people.
Forget it, I'm not going! I have my reasons! Shut up all of you!
My hip hurts! I'm in the middle of cooking a turkey! I have warranty cards to fill out! I'm not just making excuses! Alright I'll go!
Professor, you're a Professor. You must have some ideas.
Absolutely not! I won't speak! I've got nothing to hide!
Well nuts to me. I'm taking the stage! I know the source of the greenhouse gases. But in my shame I've kept it secret for 75 long years. Ohhh, it haunts my memory still.
Professor no, don't do it!
Don't do what? Don't use this memory ray so I can remember what happened back then?
Oh dear, I've failed again.
Its not always a burp. We still have one problem though. This robot will never meet emission standards.
Well...I suppose the environment can take one more for the team.
Oh this is all my fault!
That's awful Professor. Especially the making out part.
All modern robots descend from my original smog blasting designs. And that's the cause of global warming today.
I got a good feeling about this!
Wait, surely there's a better -
Come on. You've got to come out of your chest sometime.  Would you do it for a Bender snack?
Let me go! I don't even want the stupid beer!  Yes! You tried to trick me into coming out of my chest. But who has the beer now?  I've got mail.
We all figured that out.
Wait. We could hide you! We'll pile fruit on you and claim you're a bowl.
No. I'm going to the party.
Fry, as you know, there are lots of things I'm willing to kill for. Jewels, vengence, Father O'Mally's weedwhacker. But at long last I've found something I'm willing to die for. This mindless turtle.
Bender, this world isn't good enough for you.
Not even close. Goodbye everybody. Don't touch my stuff after I'm dead!  (shouting) It's booby trapped.
Poor guy. Maybe you'd feel better if I had a drink.  Crummy kegg it's completely ta -  Oh you're a robot.
Nah, I'm not really in the -
I have to say goodbye now. There ain't not turtles where daddy's a-going. (whispering) Don't tell anybody but Nixon's about to shut all robots off and -
Shut up and pay attention to me! Bender. Look, I love life and its pleasures as much as anyone here, except perhaps you Hedonismbot.  But we need to be shut off! Especially you Hendonismbot!
We pollute too much. We're destroying the world and killing the turtles.
No one insults the turtles!
I've devised a way to save you and to stop global warming at the same time! Granted you're all blasting out greenhouse gases.

But we can use those very gases to save the planet. If you all vent your exhaust directly upward in one burst it should thrust the Earth further from the sun, thus cooling it.  By my calculations we'll need the full force of every last robot. So quickly, everyone point your exhaust vents straight upwards.  Now vent! Vent like the wind!  Harder! Harder!
Why isn't this working?!
Some lazy or polite robot is holding it in.
A billion robot lives are about to be extinguished! Oh the Jedi's are going to feel this one!

I'm sorry buddy. At least we'll die on our backs, helpless.  Huh? What the hell are you doing?  Hey are you trying to make me look bad?  Ah ha! I'm even greater than I thought I was! And now to fullfill my destiny.
Thank you. I deserve this!
Hey Professor! Now that the Earth's orbit is further from the sun won't that make the year longer?
Why yes! One week longer to be exact.

Ahem! For my next trick, notice I have nothing up my sleeves......and nothing in my head.  So if my lovely assistant will kindly supply me with an ordinary, non-fake pitcher of milk......behold the milk has vanished! Exiled, perhaps, to another dimension!
Amazing! That's why they call you "Bender The Magnificent"!
Whoa! They discovered an intact, 20th Century pizzeria! Just like the one I used to work at!
Interesting. No wait the other thing - tedious!
Lets go check it out. You can see how I lived before I met you.
You lived before you met me?
Sure. Lots of people did.
Truly, they were as Gods who build this place!
Wait a second! This is Panucci's! I used to work in this exact pizzeria! And for your information lady, this was not just used to paddle my butt, it was also used to move pizzas and crush rats.
Don't wave your fancy degrees at me. I recognise all this stuff.  Petrified sausages, Old Mr Patelli, and that's -
Pizza delivery for Mr......Seymour Asses.
I wouldn't count on it.

Aww. Poor little guy. You look like you haven't eaten in a month. Here......but if Mr Panucci asks, your name is Seynour Asses!  I like you Seymour, you're not constantly judging me like all the other dogs - are you? Nah. We understand each other.  People think you're a dumb mutt who smells bad, can't find a girlfriend and has a crummy job. But you're keepin' it real and call no man "Mister."  Well goodbye.  Live long and prosper.
Yuck! That's the least appetising calzone I've ever seen!
No! That's my dog in there! It's an outrage I say!
I'm taking him home and I'd like to see anyone try and stop me.  Uh-oh!
...And then he was ejected by the guards. Needless to say, I was mortified.
Well it's not right to make my dead pet an exhibit. That's like digging up Lassie and putting her on display in the Louvre.
I know, I was deliberately describing a similar situation.
Why don't you try protesting? Like those native Martians. Always whining that people don't treat their ancestor's bones with respect.
Nah, protesting never works.
You're right.  I'll give it a shot!
It says this part of The Hustle implores the Gods to grant a favour. Usually a Trans-AM.
I'm walking on sunshine! Ooo-oo-ooh! I'm walking on sunshine! Ooo-oo-ooh! At a boy Seymour! Right here waiting for me as always! Just like that huge mushroom in my shower!
Seymour, cleanup!  Good dog!
He's so cute! He can do two things at one time: Eat and swim. Ooo - three things.
Fry, its been three days. You can't keep boogie-ing like this. You'll come down with a fever of some sort.
So do I get Seymour back? Are you caving to political pressure?
His name was Seymour. He was once intimate with the leg of a wandering saxaphonist. He had wet dog smell, even when dry. And he was not above chasing the number 29 bus.
Lady and Gentleman! How 'bout a hand for my temporary replacement assistant?
You are not fit to wear Fry's leotard!
Hooray, he's back! He's looking for a garbage can to put that dog in! Here you go buddy!
No, actually we've discovered Fry's dog was fast-fossilised, preserving it's cellular structure!
Which means...we can clone it! Seymour will live again!
Can you believe it Bender? I'm going to have my best friend back!

Ah Cubert, my precious babe. I'm going to attempt to clone Fry's dog. Using the very same apparatus I used to clone you!  Ooo look, there's a smidge of toe still in here.  You see, beneath the fossil's crunchy, mineral shell, there's still a creamy core of dog nougat!
So will Seymour remember how to sing Walking On Sunshine?
Amazingly yes. In cases of rapid fossilisation, I can press this brain scan button, retrieving Seymour's memories at the precise instant of doggy death!
I'm gonna get my puppy back! In your face, Grim Reaper!
Crappy ineffective Reaper!
I just need to reset the Clone-O-Mat from Human Mode to Dog Mode.
Uh-oh, this may take a while.
But I'm celebrating New Years Eve.
I won't be gone long Seymour. Just wait here 'til I come back.
Hello? Pizza delivery for......Icy Wiener?! Aw crud! I always thought at this point in my life I'd be the one making the crank calls!  Here's to another lousy Millenium.  What the?
A dog collar for me?  You shouldn't have!
Oh.  Say why'd you get me a subscription to the Daily Growl? That's not a reputable journal of opinion.
Oh that's also for Seymour. I'm getting everything ready for when he's cloned.
Are you on the jump Fry? Why are you wasting time on a creature of inferior intelligence?
Hey he was smart. He could fetch.
Hello? Charlamange?  Plus, I'll bet he couldn't create a laser show with his head.
Look Bender, this has nothing to do with you.
Now if you'll excuse me I'm working on Seymour's doghouse.
No one ever asks if Bender would like to live in a tiny little house. Not that I would. A tiny little house that says "Bender" on it.  Ow!
This is Fry. If you're calling about the used towels for sale, they're still available for $45 each.
Are you two gonna be done soon?
Sorry, but we need to practice hand to hand combat in case an enemy knocks the laser gun out of our hands and they slide waaay across the room.
Well could you do it some place else? I'm setting up Seymour's doggy bed.
Heel boy, heel! Oh hello Fry, I guess I didn't notice you there. I'm having such fun with my new best friend Robo-Puppy.
I was just out walking him. Yes. You can walk him. Of course, after he goes you have to refill the canisters. C'mere boy! Pet, pet, pet.
Jealous? Hah!  Not while I have the love of Robo-Puppy here. Robo-Puppy, lick my cheek.
Robo-Puppy truly is robots best friend! Eh?

Behold once more the mighty Clone-O-Mat! Requiring such vast amounts of electricity that we must harness the elemental power of nature itself!  I speak of course...of molten lava! Deep within the Earth's core. To the sub-basement!
Come on boy! Come back to life!
Fry c'mon, the talent show!
What? I'm in the middle of something.
But, if we don't perform, in what sense do we have an act?
Bender, enough! Leave me alone!
So that's how it is huh? I thought you were my friend. But if you love your dog so much then maybe you'd rather play fetch!
I hate you! I hate you! You evil metal man!  Ow!
So anyway your dog is melted. Now we're friends again.
Not necessarily. For the dog may yet survive.

Indeed. You see, that fossil was made of dolomite. The tough black mineral that won't cop out when there's heat all about. By contrast, observe the lava's affect on this ice swan.  Of course, that would have melted even at room temperature. I just wanted to get rid of it. But had it been made of that righteous mineral dolomite, there's a slim chance it might have survived.
So Seymour might still exist?
Perhaps. For a few minutes. It's dolomite baby!
Then I'm goin' in after him.
Acting like a moron won't bring your dog back.
Then all hope is lost.  Goodbye Seymour.
Please stop crying Fry. Here.  I assumed you were just pretending to love the dog. To toy with my emotions. Oh what have I done?

Fry, I'm sorry. I should have understood how someone can love an inferior creature. Because I love you. Not in the way of the Ancient Greeks, but in the way a robot loves a human, a human loves a dog and occassionally, a gorilla loves a kitty.  I'm goin' in!
I'm a professor! Why isn't anyone listening to me? You can't go in because you'll melt. The fossil only has a chance because it's made of dolomite!
Oh it's hot, it's very hot!
Bender's been down there too long. I'm going in after him.
This is all my fault. I let my best friend risk his life just to get my dead dog back.  Bender!!
And that is why they call me Bender The Magnificent!  Hey where'd everybody go?
OK! Let's clone us some dog!
Very well. Let this abomination unto the Lord begin!  Interesting. It seems Seymour died at the ripe old age of 15.
15? You mean he lived for 12 more years after I got frozen?
Oh sure! Smash the smart guy's machine!
Think about it. Seymour lived a full life after I was gone. He probably added new songs to his repertoire.
But that's a good thing. Walking On Sunshine sucks noodles!
I had Seymour 'til he was three. That's when I knew him and that's when I loved him.  I'll never forget him. But he forgot me a long long time ago.
Ah beer! So many choices! And it makes so little difference.
How 'bout LÃ¶brau? It has dots on it.
Overruled. The choice of champions is Pabst Blue Robot!
I can't drink that! The metal shavings make my throat bloody.
(mocking) Waah waah! Baby wants a Zima!
Hey hey! We can all fight when we're drunk. Now listen: Why don't we just brew our own beer?
You can brew your own beer?
Sure, the kids at the orphanarium used to do it all the time.
And you Cubert. I cloned you from one of my warts and I can send you straight back in there.
I've warned you not to use those things!
Let's see. We've got our malt, our hops...we just need a big disposable tub to mix it in.
Now it needs to boil for a couple hours.
Crew, you remember Cubert?  Wonderful! And I'm sure you won't mind being their legal guardians for a month!
We're making beer! I'm the brewery.
Actually Dwight you're right. Alcohol is very very bad...for children. But once you turn 21 it becomes very very good! So scram!
Eh wha? Oh! This is my latest invention. A device that lets anyone sound exactly like me!
I am? That's not good news at all you little...
There is no target consumer! Only targets. Targets that will tremble as their new master hands down edicts in my glorious booming voice!  Now quit pestering me you scoundrels!
Mmm. The ingredients are cooked. And they've picked up some of your natural robot flavourings. Time to add the yeast.
Yeast? You mean I'll have a lifeform growing inside me? (crying) It's so beautiful.
If you were my kids you'd get quite a talking to...from your father......when he got home from the senate.
Oh bother, what have they done now?
Those pork dumplings sent us on a fake delivery.
The address was on Dogdoo 8 but the universe ends right after Dogdoo 7!
(shouting) Lies! Lies and slander!
Accusing gentle Bender of a misdeed? That's the last straw! You boys have been underfoot long enough!
Ooo-hoo! Here comes violence!
I guess if you want children beaten......you have to do it yourself.
(mocking) Perhaps they've constructed a teddybear hospital!
Who's going to use a delivery service with a kicked sign? Nobody that's who!
(mocking) Yes its a tremendous responsibility alright!  What if a paper were to land in a puddle?
I'm really starting to swell up with beer. I must look ridiculous.
No, you have a healthy glow.
Oh my God! I just felt it ferment!
Ooo! Let me feel.  Have you thought about what to name it?
I was thinking Benderbrau if it's an ale, Botweiser if it's a lager.
I hope it's a lager so I can take it to a ball game.  Ooo! I felt that one!
Goodness there must be 50 papers in that bundle! That's a big number, 50.
(shouting) I'm blowing you a kiss.
(shouting) It's closing in! You can't avoid it! It's a cheek-seeker. And...gotcha!
Well, well, well. If it isn't our little muchkin moguls!
You know how much an apartment that big would cost on the Sun?
That's why we need you, our loyal crew, to make Planet Express 800% more profitable.
Uh guys, I don't know how to tell you this. So I'll just let Fry blurt it out thoughtlessly.
We don't work for you anymore!
Dwight and Cubert made us a better offer. We're paperboys now.
We're on it Mr Farnsworth!
Folks, the situation is grim but we shall prevail, thanks to you, our crack team of loyal dregs!
Yes, of course you are. Now we've got to buckle down and save Planet Express.
Balderdash! I never agreed to that!
Tax dodge nothing! You take one nap in a ditch in the park and they start declaring you this and that.
There. One million papers. Folded and loaded!
And what's your scientific basis for thinking that?
Did I ever tell you how I used to own that ship?
(singing) Hush little brewsky don't you leak. Daddy wants to drink for at least a week.  Oh my God! I think it's time!
Hurry Leela, get some coasters and cold mugs.
It feels like I'm trying to push a water bed out of me.
Almost there. Just two more bottles.
Is it OK? I can't hear anything.
It's an ale! 5 gallons, 6 ounces!
Hey wait a second. How did you deliver a million papers in one hour?
Hello, Awesome Express, the rude, crude delivery dudes! How may I direct your call?...What's that?...You haven't gotten your paper?...In how long?...
Uh, might a homeless old man have a touch more beef bourguignon? And another tequila slammer?  Please?
They're so stinking talented they don't even need their fathers anymore.
You did? Tough luck suckers!
Why did you boys do all this?
Damn right we are! Now come on. Let's go do a little Father/Son weaseling out of this.
Now now, no need to give us the business. We'd like a word with you daddy.
Mr Blob, our sons have come to apologise for damaging your window. They've learned their lesson and they want to make amends.
Now see here. We assured our sons that you'd accept their apology.
No one gives my son that option!
He's coming to finish the job. Someone toss me out the window!
Hey chumps! I heard you were on the ass end of an ass kicking so I figured you could use a couple of these babys!
Uh, won't join us Mr Blob?
It would seem we've taught our boys a lesson about life: Man or Blob, it's whats inside that counts.
There's no denying it: The future's crazy! Oh, well. Don't wanna stand out.
(singing) Freedom, freedom, freedom, oy!
... an extremely dangerous mission ...
So, what is Freedom Day? Sounds like some kind of feminine hygiene product.
You know? Like how I live every day.
Of course, it wouldn't be Freedom Day without the traditional Freedom Tub!
Wow! Nude hot-tubbing? That's all I need to hear about Freedom Day!
(shouting) We're not listening!
Scuse me, comin' through. Freedom train arriving on track one.
Anyone who laughs is a Communist!
Scuse me, comin' through. Freedom train, step aside. You too, fatso. Freedom!

Cool your jowls, Nixon. You may not like it that Dr. Zoidberg desecrated a flag. You might even find the image of it festering in his bowels somehow offensive. But the right to freedom of expression is guaranteed by the Earth constitution.
They sure hate Dr. Zoidberg.
Pft. Posers! I was hating Zoidberg before it was cool.
Where are we ever going to find a lawyer to take his case?
I'll ask the head of the ACLU. Once he's done singing.
I'll never remember that.
And you wanna defend Zoidberg? Are you familiar with the old robot saying "Does Not Compute"?
(sad) The sparks keep me warm.
Wait, you're a lawyer? You're hired!
You OK there in the embassy, Zoidberg?
Court's kinda fun when it's not my ass on the line! Nachos?
Six to three? I beat the spread!
Dr. Zoidberg, how can you claim to love freedom and then enslave all of Earth?
What the hell is this dirt pile we're building anyhow?
I'm no good at being a slave. I'm thinking about graduate school. Y'know? To become a barber?
This can't go on. Today is the day we fight back!
It's already 10 o'clock!
Oh, you're right. Tomorrow is the day we fight back.
Hey, wait! I'm having one of those things. You know? A headache with pictures?
Back in my day, we didn't have your fancy all-digital weapons but we still managed to kill each other just fine.
Ah, the crossbow. A pitiless, elegant killing machine. The Bender of the 15th century.
Not big enough. We need something that can take out an entire army. Something you could commit a war crime with--
